title: It's decent
text: I have never used a one piece Bluetooth to use when conducting calls. I have always used both ears. My husband has own one of these for over a couple of years and lives it so I decided to give it a try.  Must say I LOVE it, too! The sound quality is ok. I was hoping for a crisp, clear sound from the ear piece but this one, at times, makes crackling sounds or echos. It has noise canceling but I didn't really notice it. The other con is that they only give you 3 sizes of the ear piece and maybe my ears are odd but I have tried every one of them and they don't sit very well slightly in my ear. It pops out. So that affects the sound quality. I have to keep pushing the ear piece in. However... the pros are this: I love when the phone rings and the plantronics asks to either answer or reject the call. Nice feature. And it tells you how much talk time you have when you switch it on. Other than that, this review sums it up.

title: Inconsistent and slow for the Samsung Note10+
text: I purchased 2, 1 for home and 1 the work.  The device has a great sleek look, light weight, and doesn't appear to overheat.  The first charging experience was relatively fast, from 15% to 100% in about 59 mins.  My second charger (purchased device) took about 1hr 11mins. For subsequent changes, the charger kept "pausing the charge", as it says on the bottom of the screen. Finding the "sweet spot" of the charger in order to keep the charge going, took several [frustrating] tries moving my devices around on the ledge or lip of the charger.  Then the charge became extremely slow, up to almost 4 hrs for a full charge.  Finally, it seemed as if it stopped acknowledging my phone. Not having a phone case, I tried wiping my phone off and still nothing. This all happened over the course of the first five days.  I'm hitting the return button as soon as I post this.

Firstly, this light only has a three settings that manage the brightness of the light, but all settings are the same blueish toned light. I don't particularly like the way it looks on me and I also think in general my phone (Google pixel 3xl) plus this light just give me overexposed images, or very obvious artificially lit images.

Also it took over a fair portion of my screen which also makes it a bit more difficult to see my screen and its just kind of annoying.

text:
I was interested in this product because I have pop sockets on my phone and have really enjoyed them but they do make the backside of my phone a bit bulkier and unable to work with certain chargers or car mounts.

This is slimmer than a popsocket by a bit but not much. I didn't find that it worked any better with wireless touch chargers.

I also don't think the holder is as comfortable as the pop sockets. It feels flimsier...

Perhaps if you like the look of this product over other items then I'd give it a shot, but I'll probably just stick with what I have.

title: I stuck this on my getting ready mirror, works great!:)
text:
Ive tried products like these in the past for my car and they don't work the best on larger phones, heavy phones, or phones with bulky cases. They also tend to come off the magnet at abrupt stops or sharp turns.

Fortunately, I don't need a phone holder for my car, and instead wanted to use this for my getting ready mirror.

I like watching YouTube videos when I get ready in the morning and this has been awesome for that! Definitely secure and strong enough for that.

I'm not sure how easy removing the magnet from the mirror would be so I probably won't ever attempt it to save damaging my mirror.

So I guess this phone mount will be better or worse depending on what you're needs will be.

Hope this review is helpful!:)

title: Very compact, great for travel!
text:
I love having powerbanks handy for travel, concerts, emergencies etc. We use our phones for so much these days it's just a good idea to always have a power bank handy.

This one is nice and compact, the design is cute too (looks like a Duracell battery).

It's worked great so far, easy to charge, easy to use. You just push the on button and connect.

Great!

title: Kind of a weird mount but solid magnet
text:
The strength and size of the magnet is one of the best I've seen. It's very good at keeping your phone in place. I did try to use this by just adding the magnet between my phone and case but because my case is on the thicker side it was not strong enough to hold. If you're phone is on the heavier side or has a bulky case it may slide off during aggressive stops or turns.

I knocked a star off because I find the construction of the mount to be a bit strange. I don't know why it only allows you to fold in/hang lower. I don't have a lot of dash space so it blocks my vents in most places.

title: Won't work with case or certain popsocket placement
text:
So this product was probably never meant for use with the way I like my phone.

I always have a case on, not very thick, but not slim either, and I always have a popsocket on my case as well.

I tried putting the magnet through the case and that didn't work well. Then I tried on the outer of the case but because of the popsocket the placement didn't work well for me and would have the phone on the magnet sitting disproportionately, making it fall off at the slightest bump or even just coming to a stop.

I have a larger phone (pixel 3XL) so I don't see myself taking the case or popsocket off only to make this work. I'd rather protect my phone.

The amount of space my phone blocks on my airvent was an issue too, I have a Prius C and it blocks more than half of one of my vents. In this summer heat I can't afford to lose that much AC. Lol

I think this would work a lot better with smaller phones and users that don't use cases

title: Such a great little charger!
text:
This little portable charger is such a great item!

It's small, but weighty. I keep it in my backpack or car when I travel, it charges fast and fully charges my phone up to 3 times before having to be charged again.

I have a pixel 3xl so I had to get a separate cable that had a USB side to it in order to charge, but once I got it and tried it out, it got my phone charged up super quick.

Would recommend to anyone! So great for travelling, hiking, or just any times you may not be able to charge your phone.

title: Nice all plastic charger, a bit overpriced for what it does
text: The Belkin Wireless Charger is a nice addition to your desk setup. It is by no means a replacement for your plug in charger, but it still has it's uses. The phone cradle is 9cm wide and should fit most/every phone. I use the charger for my pixel 3 xl and it still has plenty of room. The charger is completely plastic, but has a sturdy feel to it. There is hardly any flex to the charger. This is also because nothing on the charger is adjustable. It is plenty stable and visible when placed on a desk where one's monitor would be. The charger also causes my pixel 3xl to say "charging rapidly", but it is still fairly slow, and takes about 2.5 - 3 hours to fully charge (the norm for faster wireless chargers that aren't the $80 Google dock, imo). The charger does cause your phone to warm up, but that has been my experience with most wireless charging devices. It is nothing extreme. Similar to leaving your phone in the sun on an 80 degree day. I was happy with this charger.

title: Is not UL specified as listing described
text:
Item description states it meets UL specifications. It does not from the item's markings and I returned to a friend to return. (Pictures)
UL - Underwriter Laboratories - certification has been an American standard of quality and safety since founded in Chicago in 1894 and I won't use an electrical or electronic device in my home lacking this symbol. Especially plugged in overnight!

title: False information about iWatch SE support as missing USB C adapter
text:
Item description and vendor pIctures indicate support for an iWatch SE - which requires a USB C port. The stand does not have one!

In the picture I took you can clearly see the base of this Anker stand has a USB A adapter.
The Anker picture and description attached also shows a USB A port which is not what an iWatch SE needs - a USB C cable.

I reported this to Amazon but nothing has changed - caveat emptor. They're a big enough seller!

Also wondering how long it will take until Amazon requires electric devices sold to be UL LISTED - see photo for lack of US electrical certification stamps or seals. This is really unacceptable for products we're expected to charge over $1,000 of electronics overnight and not worry about a fire or overheating.

title: Not UL Listed

title: Great value wireless headset
text:
I bought these as a backup headset for web conferencing with my PC, laptop, or tablet. I've got top of the line headsets for wired and wireless for my conference calls but unfortunately I sat on the wireless headset and broke them - while waiting for a replacement from my employer I bought these and they're EXCELLENT!!
I would be happy to use these daily as my primary headset as the battery life is amazing, connectivity is great and maintains well at distances even going downstairs from my office. Great strength of signal. Sound quality is great and noise cancellation is good. I've got big dogs who are noisy and it's challenging to cancel their barks - I don't care they're family.
Whether for primary or backup use I recommend these.

title: Easy to setup and use; great value for your money
text:
Working from home and constant Zoom and Team video calls with different lighting conditions due to weather changes is a problem. I'd read about these lights and thought, nah, these are only for the young Tiktok generation. Wrong!
This has made a tremendous difference in my appearance on my video conferences. I was shocked at the positive difference and would recommend this to anyone on Zoom or any videoconferencing system from home. Simple to power from your USB port it's even got a clamp if you use a mobile device for your calls. Great value, simple to setup and use, and been great to have.

text: This case is simple, just clear flexible plastic. It fits perfectly and all the buttons work.  I wish it was maybe a touch thinner.

title: Better quality than some
text: This case is a little bigger and a little thicker plastic than some of the cheaper cases like this that I have seen. I can fit my galaxy S9 plus in it in its case, which is nice. I don't think I would trust the closure underwater though. I just don't have enough faith in it. I think it'll be OK for incidental water splashes at the pool or the beach or a rain storm though. It's designed so that it's easy to operate the buttons on the side of the phone, so that's kind of nice.

title: OK
text: I have to say, I would never intentionally immerse my phone in this case. I don't feel confident enough in the closure. I think it'll be OK for taking it to the beach or the pool where it might get splashed, but I would never trust it underwater. The seams on the side make it a pain to operate the side buttons on my galaxy phone.

title: Works well but lights are annoying.
text:
Edit: It turns out that the panel DOES turn off, it was just a problem with the switch on my unit.


The charger seems to work fine and I like the voltage and amp read outs. I don't like the fact that the backlight on the display can't be turned off. It's really bright.

title: Absolute junk. Battery life is way worse than the old, swollen battery I replaced.
text: First, the instructions provided are not for the phone the battery is for. They are also pretty much microscopic. Yeah, ok,  they tell you to watch the YouTube video, but if all you have to watch videos on is your phone, obviously that's not going to help while you're trying to do this repair. And then after all that, the battery wouldn't charge. Some time on YouTube gave me the info to fix that problem, but the battery life is crap. It only lasts a few hours. The old, swollen original battery held a charge for much longer. Absolute junk. I would give this negative stars if I could.

title: Small and light
text: I had another phone holder like this, and it was a lot bigger and a lot heavier. Which is great if you're just going to leave it in the studio. I carry my stuff around, and I travel in an RV, so this one is perfect. It's much smaller and lighter than the other ones that I have seen.

title: Simple and effective.
text: Simple and effective. I like this phone holder. Yes, if you put a big travel mug or some thing in the cupholder you're not going to be able to see the phone. Well that's not a big deal to me since I'm not looking at my phone while I'm driving. But the biggest thing is, I keep a lot of things in my cupholders that aren't cups. And this works perfectly for those items.

title: Doesn't last.
text: This battery, which is supposedly higher capacity than the original one, does not power the hotspot as long as the three-year old OEM battery that I was replacing. It's going back.

title: Looks like crap and accumulates tons of pocket lint
text: This screen protector is just awful. I don't know if it had abrasions when I got it or if it got damaged during install with the rough squeegee provided but it had marks on it right off the bat. And an area that looked like orange peel. Well, I figured I'd give it the 72 hours to smooth out. It did a little, but not enough. It makes the phone look like crap, it feels like crap......it's basically crap. Also, I had to to use so much of the solution to keep it from sticking to the phone that I was terrified that I would damage it. Never again.  Last but not least, the slightly sticky surface of the plastic means it's always covered with pocket lint. Just awful.

title: Works as expected.
text: Since more and more stuff is using usb-c these days, it's nice to see a car charger with a c port. Works as expected and feels solid.

title: Great protection
text: The case went on easy and seems to offer great protection. It does add some bulk to the phone.

title: Working perfectly with my S9+
text: I never got the appeal of wireless charging. Until I got one. I never realized how often I wasn't plugging the phone in because it was a hassle to plus and unplug every 30 seconds.  Just dropping it on a pad is just so much easier. You'll understand the hype when you try it. This charger has been working flawlessly with my Otter Box Symmetry case.

title: Works great with my iPad Pro
text: This works great with my ipad pro. The soft large end works whether the stylus is on or off, but the fine point need the switch to be on. I'm no DaVinci but it is fun to doodle with.

title: Pretty handy. I've grown weary of having the cheap ...
text: Pretty handy. I've grown weary of having the cheap suction cup mounts let go on bumps or corners, launching my phone and/or gps into the footwell.  So far that hasn't happened here.  I did think it was more difficult to assemble than it needed to be.  I hope I can find the tablet mount, I have an iPad mini that I'd like to run Waze on too.

title: I generally just move if the cell service is that bad, but since I've been in Florida for a ...
text: This thing is a godsend if you NEED internet connectivity.  I generally just move if the cell service is that bad, but since I've been in Florida for a while where my Verizon just doesn't cut it I thought I'd give this a try. First thing is, be prepared for an absolutely ginormous box to show up. It's like 6 feet long and weighs a ton.  I'm taking off one star for the huge heavy collapsible mast. I think most truly stationary RVers will mount it on a better mast. And most folks who move now and then will be able to get by with something lighter.  So I feel that antenna mast should be optional and would reduce the considerable cost somewhat. YMMV.

title: Not quite ready for prime time.
text: I love the look of the phone. Everyone who sees it says, "Ooooh, what is that?" Looks aren't everything though. This is a first generation product and there are some things that need work. Specifically, the camera app. OMG, I feel like I'm in a time machine back to my first smartphone, where every small needed the manual. And come on, no panorama mode? I'm hoping this will be fixed in an update. I'm taking off a star for that. The other thing I'm not enamoured with is the finish. It looked awesome for about 15 seconds, until I touched it. It's one of those finishes that absorbs oil from your hands and looks like crap immediately. I'm also not a fan of the current trend of not putting an sd card slot in Android phones anymore. That was one of my biggest gripes with Apple and now Android is starting to go the same way. Yay, cloud and all, but sometimes there's no internet, and sometimes you don't want to put all your stuff in someone else's pocket. A pocket which might go away at any time.  I knew it didn't have an SD card slot when I got it but I didn't expect it to annoy me as much as it has.

title: So far so good. I have had no issues with these so ...
text: So far so good. I have had  no issues with these so far. They fit and they work. Oh, and they're pretty cheap. Sure beat the $20 they wanted for a spare USB-C cable at the phone store.

title: Like others have said
text: It fits the screen perfectly. Like others have said, watch the video, start with clean hands and workspace, and it should all be good.

title: Love the big screen
text: Great phone. I upgraded from an iPhone 4s and it's the difference between night and day. The camera is great. The battery life is so much better, despite the gigantic screen. The touch screen is responsive. Every app I've tried runs just fine. I popped in my ATT sim (I had to cut it down to nano size first) and it worked right away with no fiddling with APNs or anything like that. The only negative is, I don't care for the side power button. It's finicky and often takes multiple presses to make anything happen. It's definitely not a pocket phone though.

title: When you need it you'll be glad you have it.
text: I travel a lot by RV so my cellphone is my lifeline, not to mention my only means of internet a lot of the time. Dropped calls and slow loading webpages are a drag. The weBoost booster is a big help. In Florida I saw my signal strength go from -84 to -68.which is a pretty decent improvement. One problem I had seen with the previous products (when the line was called Wilson) was the cradle getting unacceptably hot. This seems to have been solved with the weBoost line. They've also made the cradle a bit more substantial with holding arms that are easier to adjust when swapping phones. It seems a little pricey for what it is. However, it does cut down on the aggravation of losing signal all the time enough that I wouldn't be without a booster in my car or rv.

title: Too hot to handle.
text: Hot, hot, hot!!!! This thing runs so hot I'm fearful it will damage my phone eventually. I measured over 170 degrees with my laser thermometer. It boosted the signal to usability but if it fries my phone it won't be worth it. So I only use it when I absolutely must. Which is a bummer as it wasn't cheap.

title: Didn't work at all, and in fact made things worse
text: I just got back from a trip to AZ & NV and I had high hopes for this device as I was going off the beaten path.  What a disappointment!  It didn't work at all, and actually made the number of bars on ATT go from 2 to 1!  For TMobile there was nothing, it was like it wasn't even there.  All it did was run my battery down and generate a fair amount of heat.  It's going back to Amazon for sure.

title: Ball head doesn't tighten enough.
text: It looks like a nice sturdy item but the ballhead does not tighten enough to keep the camera upright.  No matter how hard I tried I could not get it tight enough so that the camera wouldn't eventually flop over while driving down the road.  And the video was unacceptably jumpy due to that even when it didn't fall over.

title: Just Loving This Phone
text:
Apparently a few steps shy of a basic smartphone, and exactly what I need. I've even emailed a few photos successfully! I am still getting acquainted, but the touch screen is wonderful -- it is sensitive, so you have to learn your touch. I can now make fast movements without hitting the wrong buttons accidentally. It didn't take me long to learn basic texting, dialing, receiving calls, retrieving messages, straight-ahead photography (nothing fancy). I am enjoying my phone after just a month, without even teaching myself all it has to offer.

A great bonus is the LG840G is wired for WiFi use! You will not be charged precious minutes for talk time. I have to check this out, but a friend told me to be careful, that instead, you may be charged data/data storage fees. If I find this is so, I will come back and amend this review.

Anther bonus, I think, is that when I finally expand my life to really need smartphone bells and whistles, I believe this phone will have stepped me up nicely into that arena. As it is, this phone has more than enough to fill my current music-listening, audio- and video-recording, scheduling, note-taking, social networking, web-based needs. This is a only 2.0 MP camera, but I was recently complimented on a photo I took (and texted on the spot!).

It's a great design -- looks like smartphones in my circle of friends, so there was a LOT more respect toward me and my phone than previously. In fact, 3 people on separate occasions thought I had finally gotten a smartphone, and only me and Tracfone know for sure...

I've only had it a month and I'm a slow learner, so I'm sure there is much more to get to know, but I am loving this phone as is.

title: A mighty charging power bank
text: I love my new power bank! Oh I do! It's sleek, smooth, naturally portable, durable, reliable and I am enjoying a freedom from hunting for outlets at the airport, at a large conference gathering, or needing to adapt to less-than-comfortable wall outlets in a hotel room simply because my 10' charging cable is still too short to reach my laptop. While at the home front, I can go camping or hiking knowing I will not run out of power for six months between charges!! That's incredible!! I've seen the comments on how long it takes to charge the power bank and I admit, I did hesitate to buy it, but I'm so glad I went through with it! When I received my new Anker power core, the instructions clearly stated to use attach both charging cables that came with the Anker power core, into a multi-connection wall charger. The power bank came with almost a 50% charge capacity and that was pretty pleasing to me already. I decided to see how long it took to reach each cell level (there are 4 indicator lights that blink until that cell "fills up" before moving on to the next flashing indicator light.) To move from 25% to 50% took 20 minutes. To move from 50% to 75% took 3hrs, and to move from 75% to 100% took 3.5hrs, totaling 6hrs 50min. In other words, or charged up overnight and this charge will last 6 months. Would you wait 8 hours to charge your Anker power core on two charging cables twice a year?  Right! I would too! I also love the light carrying pouch that comes with the power bank. It's smooth curves make it easy to carry and won't harm your bag or even your hands with sharp boxy edges. It's a great joy to me to have this kind of charging freedom. I can even charge my phone and laptop at the same time! Or charge my tablet and laptop. If I was to play devil's advocate, I would first have to see how the power bank performs with different cables, if it can charge my laptop faster, for instance. If this product gets upgraded to include a fast charging port or even 3 ports I'll be buying that one as well. This is a great product.

title: Pen

What I mean is that i'll be using the pen for 10 minutes then go to draw a line and it doesn't appear. Then the line will start to skip or having missing parts. I'll use my finger and it works fine, but the stylus doesn't. Also, it is not 100% palm rejection, which was disappointing because that was something I was looking forward to. title: Stylus
text:
I have to first say that this pen turns out to not be compatible with my ipad. i have the 9.7 5th/6th generation ipad and that is not listed as a compatible device for this stylus. However, I will list pros and cons.

Pros: the nib that comes with it is soft and perfect for writing or drawing. It comes with 3 other replacement nibs. The pen is sturdy and has good weight to it. Quality material. There is a magnetic piece that attaches it to the charger, which is convenient and easy charging

cons: (now keep in mind i may have had these issues because it is not compatible with my device). The pen would suddenly stop responding with my ipad and again, I'm sure it's because they are not compatible. So for anyone who sees this, please only order if your device is listed in the description. But I truly gave it 3 stars because there is no real on/off button. There is a button at the top to change it from stylus to apple pen, but that doesnt work until I plug it in then it will light up (I charged it before use too). Also, you just have to let it shut off. If you press the top button it just keeps going back and forth between stylus and apple pen and does not go off.

text: I intend on using this item to film myself while doing art. I had another one before this but wasnt too fond of it because it was very hard to adjust the neck of it. However, this one is easy to adjust and stays in place with the phone secured. I especially like the color because it matches my room decor. On the photos, the pink color looks more red, but it is truly pink. It's east to clip onto a surface, by unscrewing the clamp to lift it then screwing it down to secure it. Overall would recommend this item

title: Phone clip
text: This will not work for car vents that are vertical. I have a 2018 impala and the vents are vertical rather than horizontal so it was hard to get the clip on and I could not use the adhesive on the back because of the positioning of the vents. I attempted to use it but it was not sturdy enough. It was difficult to get out because of the way it hooks onto the vent blades. I would not recommend this product if you dont have horizontal vents.

title: Gooseneck phone holder
text: I gave this item three stars because, although it is durable and works as intended, it is hard to bend. The gooseneck is very thick and takes pressure to bend and get to your desired look. Also, when I did find a way to bend it for the right angle for my phone, part of the gooseneck was showing up on camera. It is easy to adjust and clip to a surface. However, it was way too tough to bend and get to my desired angle needed for recording.

title: Usb charger
text: The charger is very pretty in person, and shiny. My phone (s10 plus) is used to fast charging with the original cord so it usually doesn't fast charge with other things. That said, this didn't charge quickly but did do so normally. Good quality as well. Would recommend the item.

title: Stylus
text: I use this with my son's school ipad. He has to do a lot of writing assignments and this was helpful so he wasnt just using his finger. It paired with the device easily. I dont like that the power button is on the end because all you have to do is touch the end to turn it on or off and i accidently hit that a lot. Also, I wish the tip of the pen had been a soft rubber material rather than hard and sturdy. Feels hards on the tablet screen. Overall, it works well and I've been using for about 2 weeks and havent needed to charge it yet.

title: Light stand
text:
-Assembly wasn't the easiest because there were no instructions, however I eventually figured it out
-There are holes for two different cameras/ phones
-The light is very bright
-provides yellow or white light
-I am 5'8 1/2" tall and the tallest it came (at the top of the light ring) was to my nose, I believe
-good quality
-easy to use with camera or phone

title: Phone case
text: I used this phone case on my iphone 8, which is my work device. The case fit well. I had no problems getting it on and no problems taking it off. It is a nice jelly like case, but is durable. The color is a little darker than bubble gum pink, gives the phone a nice pink hue. My phone is black, but it would look really nice on a white or lighter colored phone. Still looks nice on black though. The buttons are easy to press as well, doesnt feel like the coverings for them are too thick and impede with me using those functions.

title: Finger ring holder
text: The hole on this finger ring is kind of big. I had more room around my finger than I'm comfortable with for a finger ring. So, it wasnt as comfortable. The grey looks more like a pale blue color. The pink is vibrant and matches the picture. It did adhere well to my phone case and a few days later I moved it to another and it was easy to remove and stuck well to the other one. I ended up turning my sideways for better comfort.

title: Bluetooth car phone speaker
text: Easy to connect to device. If phone bluetooth on and device on, when getting into car then it will automatically conect to it. Sound is clear. Able to use with voice software on phone. I use bixby on my galaxy for voice commands and it worked fine. The only con is the size, it's kind of big, but other than that, works as advertised.

title: Phone
text: I did not expect much from this phone, but it actually impressed me. First, as with any android phone, setup was pretty easy through google. The phone also came with a case and screen protector, which is great because it's not a popular brand or model so that may have been difficult to find. The phone also came with a sim card that already had a 3 month plan included through mint mobile, which uses t-mobile service so the service is great. The phone is pretty fast and responsive to touch. It has a very clean look, things dont look out of focus or pixelated. The calls are clear. The phone is light, although it's a little thicker than most phones these days, but that is because it has a removable battery. This is a great alternative to spending hundreds or thousands of dollars on the latest devices. The only con is that not all android apps are available, but that's to be expected with some uncommon devices.

title: Phone case
text: I have an iphone 8 and it fits the phone well. This is a flexible, but thick phone case. I had to use a bit mroe force or pressure to push the buttons that were covered by the case. The holes do line up well for the camera, speakers, and charger port. Overall, it is easy to hold, and provides good protection, but the button coverings are too thick.

title: Phone case
text: The case comes in two parts, although it looks like one piece. There is a hard rubber part - the inside. Then there is a hard outer layer. They both are pretty thick and sturdy, so together they provide great durability. The volume buttons and power button coverings are silver. The silent button, speakers, and charger port are exposed. The case snaps together so it is secure and the volume and power button are easy to press, even with the coverings. I have an iphone 8 and it fits the phone well.

title: Phone case
text: The case has a pretty design, there are hearts and glitter that float throughout the back of the case. The back is soft to the touch, it feels squishy when you press on it. But not too soft that the liquid would come out. The inside, where the phone goes, is hard. The sides are thinner and flexible. The buttons are easy to push and all the holes lines up well. I have an iphone 8 and it fits the phone well.

title: Phone case
text: I gave this case 2 stars because it is so hard to take apart and get on and off the phone. It comes with a clear rubber piece, and a front and back piece. You have to pull the covering open that's covering the charger and pull the entire rubber piece off the case, which is not easy. Then you have to pull apart the front and back piece. You reverse this process to put the case on. However, there were absolutely no directions for how to de-assemble and assemble this case so it took me about 10-15 minutes trying to figure it out. I would only recommend this phone case if this is something you plan to leave on your phone and you don't change cases often. I have to say the case is very thick and sturdy and will definitely provide protection though. I have an iphone 8 and it fits the phone well.

title: Phone case
text: The phone case is made of a thick, hard plastic. The sides are clear, but the back is frosted, so it looks foggy. There are soft coverings over the buttons, which allows you to access the buttons easily. The case isn't the best for protection. It can probably help with soft falls or short falls, but nothing major.

title: Phone case
text: I gave this phone case 3 stars because it makes the phone wider than it already is and the phone is wide enough on its own. Therefore, the phone with the phone case is uncomfortable to hold in the hand because it is too wide. The case has a clear backing and thick black sides. The inside is lines in red. The clear backing allwos you to view the original phone color. The buttons are easy to press with the case on. The backing is pretty thick and feels like glass.

title: Wallet case
text: The case is grey seude and kind of has a hint of green to it. There is orange stitching. The first opening has 5 card slots on the left with two pockets on that side as well. On the right, there is a card slot for ID with a clear viewing and a zipper pouch. The zipper pouch is kind of tight, could possibly fit a little bit of change in there. The next compartment - with the phone - has 5 card slots on the left, the bottom slot has a clear viewing. On the right, there is the detachable phone case. The phone case is magnetic so it goes back into the wallet case easily. The phone case and wallet match perfectly. There is a button to close the part where the phone is located, which is magnetic as well. The length of the whole item is similar to a wallet, but is obviously thicker because of the phone case inside. Also, cards fit well into the slots and are easy to put in and take out.

title: Phone case
text: There are two parts to this case: a black rubber pieces and hard piece (the designed piece). There are silver volume and power button coverings. The silent button, speaker, and charger port are all exposed. The case is thick with both parts on. Both parts snap together so it is secure and the buttons are easy to press with the case on. The design is clear, doesn't look pixelated or printed onto the case either. I have an iphone 8 and it fits the phone well.

title: Phone case
text: This case is more so for looks and not protection. It is a flexible case, not hard and not too thick. However, this is my preferred type of case because I'm pretty careful with my phones and typically buy pretty cases. This has become my favorite case for my work phone. The design looks exactly like the picture. The colors are vibrant, the gold is very shiny, and the marble even looks real. There are small coverings over the buttons, but they are still easy to press. All the holes for the speakers and charger port line up perfectly as well. I have an iphone 8 and it fits the phone well.

title: Tabet stand
text: I used these tablet stands on a 7" galaxy tablet, an 8" galaxy tablet, and a galaxy S9 and S10, and they all help up well. They measure about 2.75" wide and 3.25" long. There is a small cushioning piece on the item where the device sits. IT stands up well certically or horizontally. Although, they feel kind of thin and cheap, they still work fine.

title: Bluetooth car speaker
text: This car speaker connected easily with my phone. Once it's on and you turn the bluetooth on on your phone, it connects right away. You have to hold the power button for about a second to turn it on and long press to connect. It is loud enough and I can hear well, the other party can hear me clearly as well. I wouldn't say it's completely no hands because you still have to call on your phone. It clips to the visor and stays. I've had no issues with it falling or anything. The only thing I don't like is that the battery dies quickly. I used it for about 4-5 days and made about 1-2 calls a day on it (turning it off when not in use) and it died by the fifth day without much use. I would suggest charging it fully before use then seeing if that improves the battery life.

title: Phone ring
text: This phone ring is sturdy. The color is gold tone and doesn't look faded. The rhinestones are a nice touch, making it look like an actual ring when holding it. It did adhere well. I even removed it after a few hours from one phone case to another and the adhesion was still strong on the secon case. The material is thick and it spins 360 degrees. It is also comfortable on my finger.

title: Phone case
text: This case is very difficult to get on and off. I think this case would be best for someone who uses one phone case for their phone or barely changes their covers. When I first put it on, it wouldn't snap together in a few places and I had to press really hard. I was unable to press my power button because there was space between the case and the button on the phone. If I wanted to press the button, I would have to press hard. The phone case is strong and sturdy, I just don't like it because the difficult of removing it and putting it on and the power button issue.

title: Tablet/phone stand
text: I like that the pack comes with different colors. I was able to place my Samsung galaxy S9 on the stand horizontally and vertically without it falling over. I even placed my 8" Samsung tablet on there, but it could only stay up there horizontally. The stand swivels around 360 degrees, so you shouldn't be able to break it. I think this woruld work for personal or professional home offices.

title: Charging station
text: I wouldnt really use this item for travel. It's more something that you would place in your home and keep stationery. I use it for the multiple tablets and phones in my household and it sits on my bookshelf in the living room. The plastic pieces comes wrapped and have to be put into the charging station. They are sturdy once they are in and can hold items well. It charges at a normal rate. It came with 6 charging cords; 4 apple chargers, one usb-c, and one mini usb. The cords are short, but the length is appropriate for use at the charging station. I would recommend this item.

title: Charger
text: I had a problem with this item staying on my vent. It was hard to open the clasp to clip it to the vent then when I put my phone up there, it kept falling forward and eventually coming off. It charges at an average rate. However, I don't see myself using it because it can't hold the weight of my phone. I have a samsung galaxy s9.

title: Belkin screen protector
text: This screen protector is easy to install. It has a kit that comes with it to help with assembly. It also had numbered tabs to help with the installation and removing the thin film from the protector. It did not create any bubbles when it adhered to the screen. I've had it on my phone over a month and it still has not broken, cracked, or anything. The material is strong and fits the phone well.

title: Water resistant
text: This item fit my Samsung Galazy S9 well. The first thing I did was water test it because there was a big blue sticker on the inside of the case that says to do so before exposing phone and case to water. So I followed the instructions in the booklet and it says to submerge case under water for 30 seconds, but didn't specify a depth. So I filled a 3 inch high bow with water, placed a cup on top of the case to keep it down, and waited 30 seconds. There was no water inside the case. So I flipped the latch and unscrewed the cap on the headphone jack and had to practically pry the phone case open. You can actually pull it off by the clip but I was a little worried that I would break it that way. Once I got it off, I placed my phone on the inside of the front of the case, made sure it was secure, then placed the back on. The case was much easier going on then coming off because all I had to do was snap it back together, close the clip, and screw the cap in. I had no problems with the screen interfering with touch. There is film covering the part that scans your fingerprint, it did work, but I had to hold it kind of tight and for a second longer than usual. My picture quality was the same with and without the case. Overall, if you are an active person then this is a good case for you.

title: Simple case
text: This case fit my S9 very well. The buttons are raised enough that they are apparent and actually look like the buttons to the phone (same shape and similar height). There is a diagonal line pattern on the back, but it is not raised so the entire case is smooth. I do like that detail and the plain (non-patterned) portion at the bottom of the phone. So although it is a simple case, they've added a bit of a design to it for it to stand out. It provides better grip of the phone because the S9, without a case, is very slippery. Also, the color is a true red, not orange or pink looking. Overall, it is a nice simple case and I would recommend it.

title: Very pretty case
text: Thi case fit my S9 well. The colors are very beautiful. It is a rich red with a lot of glitter. This is a perfect case if you are really into bling. However, as with other cases like this that I have received from them, all the components of the case are not adhered together. There is the gel like outer shell, the glitter isnert, and the hard inside cover. You can pull all of the compenents apart if you wanted to. That is why I gave the item three stars. However, they don't fall apart, they will only come apart if you are trying to take them apart from one another. Other than that, it is a very beautiful case.

title: Slim fit
text: I think this is a nice phone case. When I opened the package, the clear part had a small layer or protective plastic on it that was adhered to that portion, I'm assuming to protect it. I just removed that and was able to easily put the case on my phone. It feels very slim, like I'm holding my phone, which I like because I don't like bulky cases. The part where the buttons are, are not raised (as they usually are) instead there are grooves or lines outlining the shape of the button. For my S9 this makes it a little hard for me to determine where my volume buttons are because theres another button right under it so it can get mized up.

title: All pieces not adhered to one another
text: I also have this phone case in pink and it has the same problem. Although, it is very beautifu, all the parts are not adhered together and it can be taken apart. Right out of the box, I was able to separate the TPU gel outer part (the colored part), the glittery insert (which is like a piece of cardstock paper), and and the inner shell. I want to like the phone case, but I don't like that I can just easily take it apart.

title: Thinner than other otterbox cases
text: This series is obviously thinner than the "traditional" or original otterbox cases. I think thats a good thing because it gives you the same protection without such bulk as the other ones. This case fit my phone perfectly and protects it. The only con is when I'm golding my phone with my pinky supporting the bottom, the openings that I rest my pinky on (the charger, speaker, and earphone jack) is so deep, or the edges are rigid, that it hurts my pinky after a while. Other than that, for $17.88, I would recommend this phone case for the protection it provides.

title: Durable
text: This phone case is a lot more durable then I expected. It seems to be made of a hard plastic. The twill is not scratchy, it's actually smooth enough to tolerate holding it. Which is good because no one wants a scratchy phone case. Overall, it's a nice phonse case and has a lot more thickness and weight to it then you would expect.

title: Lightweight and easy to carry
text: Loved my wallet case. It's super lightweight, cute and hassle free.

title: It works
text: I like that the on/off is on the tip of the pen not on the side. I've had others with it on the side and it's easy to turn off by mistake.

title: Working well so far!
text: Fairly easy to install on my phone. Great instructions. Working well so far. Nice added gift of stylus / stand pen.

title: Just what I needed!
text: Lightweight, affordable, nice design, and effective! This is exactly what I needed to charge my devices while outside enjoying nature! I have recommended this to all my friends. I love Anker brand products! Reliable and well made! 5 Stars!

title: Perfect fit!
text: Fits well over the Fitbit Versa and the button still function as normal.

title: Perfect
text: Fit the phone perfectly and light weight!

title: Easy to apply
text: Easy to apply and no bubble! I love it! It doesn't change the function of the phones touch screen either.

title: Heavy Duty, but Cute
text: The picture is deceiving because the case is actually rose pink, and looks great with the Lilac colored phone. This case fits the phone perfectly, and like others have said pushing the buttons on the sides are harder. There's plenty of space at the charging port to use the Type C adapters with your old Micro USB charger cords. I feel like this case will truly protect my new phone well! I didn't use the screen protector that came with the phone, I used the Wet Applied Film by Klearlook. The glass screen protector did come in perfect condition should I choose to use it one day. I'm very happy with my purchase!

title: Over a year later and still protecting!
text: My friend is still using this cover and the clear parts are still see through. Her phone has seen the floor many times and has zero cracks thanks to this cover!

title: After time pieces will start to fall off.
text: The rubber tabs on the inside arms that support the device in the cradle fall off after time, and then this can not hold your phone anymore. I found one, but lost the other one, and had to use a rubber band to keep my phone in this mount holder.

title: I love it!
text: People give me compliments on my phone case! I love it! This case can also fit over the curved glass screen protectors that you can order separately.

title: I love it!
text: People give me compliments on my phone case! I love it! This case can also fit over the curved glass screen protectors that you can order separately.

title: Perfect Protection
text: Fits over my phone perfectly and has remained cracked free for over 2 weeks! I love it!

title: WOA!!  It is extremely rare (never before) that a case makes a phone nicer looking all around!
text: I am seriously impressed!  Wish I had bought these when I was using this old phone more but damn these are nice!!

title: M300 seems great with my phone, but has EXTREMELY low volume on my PC
text:
I have a number of other headsets that I use with my PC that work great, but for some reason, at maximum volume, the M300-XT is so low that I basically can't hear anything people say, while I apparently sound fine.

2 years and two of these later, this is junk. It never worked. Waste of $200.

title: This seems nearly perfect, but the lips are raised just a bit too much
text:
Compared to my previous cases and previous phones, the lips around the front are raised just a bit much.

This gets in the way of naturally pulling up from the bottom, which is required a lot for this phone (as it is the way to go home, or switch tasks and such).

It ads a bunch of bulkiness. It could be half as tall and still protect the screen when the phone is put face down.

And it's way too thick on the back around your finger print sensor too.

Bought a different one, will return this.

title: Doesn't sound as good as Plantronics/Voyager, but pretty good.
text:
Edit: Hardly used it in the past year. Maybe half a dozen times, if that. It's completely dead.

I've always been a Plantronics guy but when I saw my latest Voyager had a proprietary charging port, I returned it and bought this.

It doesn't doesn't sound as clear as the Voyagers and fit as well in my ear, but for the price, and for having a normal USB port of any kind (specially a C one!), it's pretty nice.

title: OKay sound quality.  Works fairly well
text:
I've only ever bought Plantronics and loved the Voyagers. There is a noticeable sound quality difference. On both ends.

But this is a fraction of the price, works great, and has no problems.

AND, Plantronics has followed in Apple's footsteps now and has a proprietary charging plug instead of a using a micro or mini USB like they used to.

title: Following Apple's footsteps on using proprietary power cable. Hope EU forces them out of it too.
text:
It had difficulties pairing with my phone.

But my biggest annoyance is at their replacement of the micro USB plug with something proprietary!

WHY???

title: Excellent backward compatible charger
text: Was a bit worried about no name and charging olde stuff.  Works great!

title: Beautiful, functional, works perfectly!
text: A tiny bit stiff at first, but perfect after a few weeks

title: PERFECT case!!
text:
Fantastic cover!! Exactly what I wanted:

Great covered buttons that aren't too hard to press.

Smooth round edges.

Excellent comfortable, soft silicone grip.

Wraps around the phone firmly.

Holes are PERFECT! Moto never lays flat on it's back because of its camera sticking out. This makes sure the camera doesn't get scratched, or scratch anything else.

Returning my $20 logo case tomorrow, this is superior in every way!

title: Girlfriend loved it.  Used it in the freezing office as well as camping and field sites.
text: It seemed to be invaluable to her on cold camping trips as well as in her freezing office.

title: Best charger I've ever had.  Charges my Pixel 2 and ipad Pro 10" at the same time, rapidly.
text:
Tiny, solid, well built.

I've bought 8 so far for me and my loved ones.

Each port is 2.4a (so 4.8 total), allowing you to charge to hungry devices at the same time.

Has a low beautiful blue led in the body, so you can see the usb plug when there is nothing in it. Super low, just enough to see it, not to keep you up at night.

title: Feels soft but not too soft.
text: Tried several. Love this one.

title: Small cable replacing several others in my suitcase and my nightstand.
text: Small cable replacing several others in my suitcase and my nightstand.

title: Doesn't feel good in your hand
text:
Not a fan. the edges aren't curved and quite thick.

The whole thing doesn't have a soft jell like feeling, but a hard plastic feeling. That makes this far less of a pleasure to hold in your hand and more slippery.

title: The buttons are waaaaay to hard to press.
text: I change my devices often and love clear slim cases so I'm well familiar with this type of case but this one is so hard to use that I'm here looking for a replacement and plan on returning this one.

title: Excellent try, but note quite
text:
For 20 years I was dying for someone to make a tablet, then Apple did and became so rich they have more money than some countries now.

What's been completely obvious but missing since, is tablets with built-in phones. Skype and other "apps" just aren't good enough. And to every genius reviewer that says this is too big, or a 10" tablet would be too big to put next to your ear, well DON'T! Get a friggin headset like the rest of the planet.

Still this is no tablet/phone. It's just a large phone. It simply is not big enough to use as a tablet. Having tried many current tablets, I'd say you need at least 7" to really start feeling like you have enough realstate to be a tablet.

My biggest gripe with Samsung? This and their other phones? "By design" there is NO WAY to stop the phone to wake you up in the middle of the night when it's fully charged. The screen lights up and it makes a sound! Talking to their support and searching the web and trying the various solutions for this and Galaxy S II... there is no way to stop it.

Which engineer that thought he should push this on us needs to be fired? More importantly, why doesn't Samsung listen??

title: It sucks with Envy 15m-eu0xxx
text: The pen kept disconnecting the line. Doesn't write well at all compared to the smoothness and effortlessness of writing on an iPad. I was really hoping it would work. Sure it can tap and touch things, but so can my finger. I wanted to write with it and it does a worse job than if I use my finger. Maybe 40% accuracy in writing. Will return this item.

title: Great warranty
text: Really slick surface. Lifetime guarantee. Easy fast replacement. Highly recommended!

title: Beautiful and functional! Just what I expected.
text: Beautiful color- I can still see some of the orchid gray color on my samsung, clear edges that match well with the function buttons. Easy to snap on and stays on. Just thin enough to not add bulk if I want my phone in my pocket. And the corner bumpers keep it a little above the surface when face down.

title: Love it
text: This is a great charger. I just received it yesterday and love it. I love the versatility of keeping in the stand or take it out and use it. Highly recommend.

title: Love it
text: This is such a great buy. I was looking for a versatile phone mount that I could adjust. Perfect.

title: Five Stars
text: Awesome. Just as advertised. Extremely happy. Arrived in better than expected time.

title: Car charger
text: Excellent car charger that is well worth the money. I highly recommend it.

title: This case does not match with motorola moto 5G stylus 2022
Thumbs up for my husband.
text: I got this for my husband. He loves it being a mechanic and able to cover the screen when it is in his pocket. He loves that it attaches to metal like his locker. He does not us the wristlet but still functions like a good wallet.

title: Otterbox case is best in class
text: Otterbox puts quality first. That is abundantly clear in their Commuter Case for the BlackBerry Bold 9650. The case aligns perfectly with the buttons and ports on the device and fits snug as a glove. Though the case can't magically compensate for inherent weaknesses in the 9650's design (relative to the 8830, it feels more apt to suffer a screen crack on impact due to the screen being glass) I feel very confident the case will protect the phone from scratches and low impact falls. Also bundled with the case is a screen protector, which is functional. I will certainly look to Otterbox first from here on out when seeking protection for my smartphones. The cost/benefit ratio is tops.

title: Great cover!
text: Love the color, feel and look of it!

title: I loved the cushion inside the cover
text: I loved the cushion inside the cover, and it looks really nice. But the cover I received was ripped inside and it does not fit my 13 inch laptop, even though it says it should. Disappointing.

title: Great Product and price
text: Good looking, well made, slim design, great price.

title: great need a design a combo
text: I like this product because it very functionable.  would be even better with either a small table connection with the cup and phone holder.  I think they make a great product.  Let see how it holds up after a year.

title: WASTE OF MONEY
text: ALTHOUGHT THE STYLES DIDNT COST A LOST OF MONEY.  IT DIDNT LAST LONG AND NOT VERY RESPONSIVE ON ANY TOUCH SCREEN.  I WOULDNT BUY IT AGAIN OR RECCOMEND IT TO ANYONE

title: Don't waste ur money
text: purchased Galaxy J7 Battery from "cleant" July 26, 2020 as of now can't take charge. I suspect the batteries are not new. Used the same charging scheme on our two Galaxy J7 (original batteries) and they lasted 3.5 years. But not this one; 3 months?

title: Doesn't grip well
text: My partner stopped using it, because it doesn't stay clipped on the case, causing her to drop her new phone several times. Fortunately, the case is better at protecting than this clip is at its job.

title: Invisible, as it should be

title: Right battery for the job

title: Phone is Visable
text: It protects my phone very well given the fact the ive dropped it twice already and not a crack brake or sratch, I like that you can see your phone very well and its Not bulky on your phone fits like a skin tight glove.

title: Work like magic
text: It shows my phone clearly,fits just fine on my phone,I've already dropped my phone twice now,I had the phone cover on and it protected my NEW phone just fine

title: I love it.
text: For the price that I got it at, I'm not gonna complain at all. It's super easy to use, no installing anything. I Simply charged it when I got it. Turned it on and it was working. It's super light and super responsive. No complaints so far.

title: Easy to install.
text: I love how easy it was to Install, I haven't given any star to durability because I just bought it. I have to say this was seriously a fun and peashooter install.

title: I just don't like how I couldn't press underwater

title: Five Stars
text: I love these necklaces. Closure is already assembled so it's sped up my production.

title: Works
text: Does exactly what I needed to.

text: This stand does just what it should. Its sturdy and well built. I take it with me in my bag so I can use it in places other than home. So if you can do that, it's good for that too. title: The best phone insurance money can buy
text:
****UPDATE**** I left my phone on top of my car and got on the highway. The phone bounced off the trunk when I hit about 55mph, leaving a small dent, and then bounced and slid around until it ended up on the side of the road. I retrieved it. As far as the phone is concerned, it never happened. The case has some minor chipping on the USB flap. I am replacing it with another LifeProof FRE, since I don't think it is waterproof anymore.

If you own a Galaxy S6 and don't have this case, you're making a huge mistake!

I have owned this case for about 6 months now. I am VERY hard on my phones (I went through an Otterbox in 3 weeks). I drop them all the time. This case has held up beautifully. I admit that I do not remove the rubber flap for headphones very often (~once a week), so the reviews about it falling off may be from people who use them a lot. However, so far, mine still seals securely.

What finally convinced me to write a review? I was at the beach yesterday, and accidentally dropped my phone in the ocean. That's right: complete submersion in salt water. I'm happy to report that it survived without any issue whatsoever. As far as the phone was concerned, nothing happened. As far as the case was concerned, I wiped it off and kept going.

NOTE: you must open the USB flap to get good sound while making a call/listening to music. While this can sometimes be annoying, it is the only thing that enables the case to be waterproof. When weighed against the waterproofing feature, opening the USB flap to make a call is a minor annoyance that you quickly get used to. Just don't drop it in water while the flap is open (dropping it on the ground works fine).

text: I like that this will charge my phone and my iPad and I have it with me when I travel to be sure I never run out of juice. It works perfectly fine for a power bank. While I recognize that it's faster and easier to charge the powerbank and just use it when necessary, the addition of the solar recharging option is what brought me to this. It takes a lot longer to charge the powebank from solar but if you don't have access to electricity this is the solution. Great for roughing it' away from things like charging stations and electrical outlets. Also waterproof. It's very sturdy. Hang it on your backpack and it'll charge while you hike.

text: This works great and gives me the ability to charge 4 things at a time which if your household is anything like mine, there are never enough power adapters to go around. This is a nice and I'll use it (it does fast charge on my iPhone) when I'm not traveling but the prongs on this don't fold in and I'd be afraid it would get damaged while traveling (since I've lost a couple of other power adapters to bent prongs I'm just going to skip that part).

title: This is a good start -- I'll probably need more later.
text: Do I even need to say - this is great? Everything seems to need wall chargers and everything seems to be coming with the cable but no charger - this is the solution. They've all worked and are working fine thankfully I don't have to plug/unplug anything any more because I don't have a charger. For now, every cable has a home.

title: Works great - charges fast (yay!)
text: I've never had trouble with Belkin products and don't expect to have any with this. I actually probably won't be using it for travel as it only handles one cable and it's just easier to leave it at home or work where I don't mess with the cables. When I'm traveling I prefer a multiport charger. Still this does work perfectly and does fast charge and does come with a cable. I've noticed more and more things are coming with cables but no power block so this is probably a good thing to have around, just in case. And if you need an additional line, it's great.

title: Amazing - I can finally use my cell phone inside
text:
This was fairly easy to install - once we found out where the nearest cell tower was. After that, it was deciding where to put it so we wouldn't have cables all over the place. We attached the antenna to the roof (there was an exhaust pipe just where we needed one). We ran the cable inside and hooked it to the amplifier and ran a cable around the room to place the transmitter near the center of the house.

Prior to having this, if you wanted to talk on your cell, you had to hope the person on the other end would hold on long enough so you could get outside to talk. (Thank goodness it's Florida). Our house is new and it has some wonderful something in the roof to help dissipate the heat which totally blocks the cell signals. Add to the fact that we are in the middle of nowhere and cell towers are far apart, I wasn't actually sure this would work. But work it does and it's wonderful.

Now our phones ring inside, reception has gone from "no service" to full service and most importantly all calls are crisp, clear and easily understood (and we can talk inside).

It went up in a very short time, although we did take the instructions out and look them over so we knew what we were up against. It was very straightforward and getting onto the roof was the hardest part of the actual install. It went together easily and was up and running as soon as the connections were made. I did have to go out and purchase some cable holders because we went up and over door ways. I put a few of those plastic clips that stick to the wall in strategic places and we're good to go.

Our house is 3500 square feet and it's very long and narrow so I was a little uncertain if it would reach the outside edges but I was willing to settle for service in the main part of the house. No need to avoid "dead zones", we've walked the house from inch to inch and service never blinked. YAY!

If you aren't sure if it will work for you, take my word for it that I am not a techie in any way, shape or form. Instructions were clear, well written and easily understood. I did not need to call support for help in any way (I didn't think they'd come and climb on the roof) but once the two decisions were made: 1) where is the nearest cell tower; and 2) how do we run it for least problems with cables, the rest was just connecting cables. It did look a bit intimidating when it arrived but it was very straightforward and easy to install.

I'm going off now to make some cell calls, from my chair inside my house!

title: Handy accessory to have everywhere
text: I really like these. I have them all over the place. It's nice to be able to put my phone down wherever I want  to (instead of having to dig it out of a pocket or bag) and this is easy and foolproof to use. You can place your phone on the stand in either portrait or landscape and if you want to charge it just put it on the stand and run the cable. Works with my iphone X and a slim case.

title: Just what we needed as USB chargeable electronics become more ane more.
