title: Narrow Footprint Is Great On These
text:
I brought in two plants this winter which needed light. I have an old UPS power strip that I revamped which is near the plants, but to get a plant light, they all take USB. That is why I got these.

FOOTPRINT
These have a sideways footprint. That means on a strip, they don't block other outlets. I am very happy about that.

CHARGING
I did test these with a phone and it worked great.

AS USB OUTLET FOR MY PLANT LIGHTS
I got my plant lights and this outlet is perfect for them. My plants are now doing much better and honestly, I am very happy with these.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Nice footprint and good charging/power supply make these a winner for my needs.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. One of these would be great to take traveling or visiting. I am glad I got the set of them and recommend them if you have similar needs to mine.

title: My Husband Likes It, But It Can Get In The Way At His Subcontracting Work
text:
Recently, my husband has had the opportunity to get a new phone from Zeeker. It is designed for contracting work so it is a bit thicker and larger than his other phone. Since his pockets on some of his pants are a bit frustrating to fit a phone in, he wanted an alternative.

HOW THIS WORKS
This slides onto the belt sideways or upright. The flap shuts and opens easily when you pull on it.

FIT
This fits his Zeeker phone very well which is about twice as thick as his Moto G Power phone he was using. It does not slide out easily so it does not get loose when he is wearing it.

ANY ISSUES?
So far my husband has been a bit frustrated in certain jobs when he wears this. It can flip open or get in his way when he has to crawl into small spaces or maneuver into tiny spots in buildings. He is trying to figure out a method to keep using this while not getting in his way.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This holds the new Zeeker phone for contractors. It is a nice fit. The only challenge is to keep it on his person while my husband tries to do sub contracting jobs.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. He says that he likes this and wants to give this four stars at this point. If he has anything to change or add, I will update the review as he continues to work with this case.

title: Wish It Was A Bit More Stable For Camera (Not Using With Phone)
text:
My daughter and I have been wanting to do work on a business we tried to start up prior to the hoopla that shut the world down. Now that she has her own place, she wants to have some extra camera equipment to do some photos from her location so she does not have to do it from home.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes in a box. It has a cell phone holder and a screw on adapter for a camera.

HOW I USED THIS
I got this for a regular G12 camera from Canon. It is not overly big. This was to be for my daughter who has a larger Fuji camera. I screwed this onto the camera and pointed it at me while I was holding something to take a photo.

PERFORMANCE
Honestly, this is not as nice as another one I have used in the past. I found that it was not very stable just standing up, and that it was hard to get the legs to bend where I wanted them to and stay put. It seemed like the camera was always shifting when I didn't want it to.

THE BOTTOM LINE
When using this for a regular small camera, this just was not as stable as I wanted it to be. It works, but I have to fuss with it more than I should.

MY RATING
THREE STARS. This tripod is a good idea, but not nearly as strong or stable as others I have used in the past. My daughter will try to use it but not without frustration for sure. At least she has something smaller until we can get a better one for her. It is a task to bend it all around to find the stable spot where it wont shift or move.

title: Got This For My Fish Tanks, Works For What I Wanted
text:
When I saw this, I was interested in it because it has two outlets for AC power. It has all of the cool recharging options for phones, laptops, etc, but honestly, in a power outage, the last thing I am worried about is my devices. We have survival things to attend to.

HOW THIS COMES
This comes with all of the cords and the battery. I highly suggest you get a case for the cords and keep it tied to the handle of this battery so it does not get lost.

HEAVY
This is not SUPER heavy, but it is not lightweight either. That means if I am going hiking, this will be significant to carry with me. I tend to want to keep this at home.

HOW I USE THIS
I use this for the AC plug. I put in the plug of my outlet strip that my fish tanks are hooked up to. That powers the heaters and filters and lights. If necessary, I unplug the lights and the heaters and just let the filters run most of the time. I have 7 tanks, so I will alternate one side of the room for an hour then the other side of the room for an hour. (By the way, you have to remember to press the AC button to activate the AC outlets).

HOW LONG DOES THIS WORK?
In a power outage we had not long ago, the power was out for several hours. I was able to run my pumps during that time when necessary and all was well. I have not had to use it in an extended power failure, however.

RECHARGING
I don't have a solar panel at the moment, but I do have a gas generator which is one reason I got this. If we are in an extended situation, I can recharge this and use it for the tanks while other things are using the generator.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is perfect for taking some load off when we have power outages. With 7 aquariums this helps me to keep the filters running for various tanks alternating to keep the tanks up and running while freeing up the generator for other things in the home.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This makes me really happy to have around. It helps a lot when we have outages and that is really worth celebrating for me. We tend to have seasons of outages and things like this are a must.

title: Too Many Problems Make This Difficult To Use
text:
I thought that it would be a great idea to get this lens. I was not thinking it through when I ordered it. It is more of a hassle than it is worth.

PACKET
This comes in a nice hard case with a zipper. Inside are all of the pieces, easy to take with me.

HOW THIS WORKS
There is a clip. This clip screws onto the lens. The lens has a cap on both sides of it, so you remove those. Then once you screw in the cap you remove the cover from the top of the lens. The idea is that you clip this onto your camera and snap pictures. IF only it were that easy.

PROBLEMS
First of all, I as not thinking when I ordered this. Most people have cases on their cameras. I figured that this would accommodate for that. Well, it does not. Any kind of case at all, even paper thin cases cause problems with this lens. That means that you have to REMOVE the case before you take a photo every time.

Secondly, some cameras fit this better than others. The best fit for this was my Moto Power phone. The samsungs gave me no end of trouble as they just would not fit well unless I took the whole thing apart.

DOES IT WORK?
I tried this with the thinnest case I have and I could get the lens to work- sorta. I took a photo for you. One of them is without the lens, the other is with. If you look at the one with the lens, it is still rather blurry. I tried many photos with the case on and no matter what, I could not get it to take a clear photo.

I am not about to remove my case just to use a stupid lens all of the time, so this is about useless for me unless I catch a really nice photo off my porch some day and I have the time to do all of the acrobatics to get this thing ready. At that point, I will probably bring out my old G12 camera and do it that way.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you have a camera that you never use a case on or that you whip out of your case all of the time, you might find you love this. If not, I find it too much of a hassle to try to get a photo. I would prefer to get out my old digital camera instead that has panoramic view as an option if I really want one.

MY RATING
TWO STARS. This really is too impractical for most people who want to have a case on their phones. I wish I had thought of that BEFORE I got it, but I didn't. I wish there was an adapter to add to compensate for cases and get a good photo.

title: Great Power Bank, But Solar Charging Not Great
text:
I have been trying to get some power banks to help us in times of power outages which we get now and then. This power bank has some good features and one that is not so great.

SIZE
This is a substantial sized power bank. It is not oversized, but it is not tiny either.

PLUGS
I love the 3 different plug styles on this. This will allow for recharging of Type c mini usb and lightning items. The plugs tuck right into the unit which I LOVE

CHARGING IN OUTLET
This charges pretty well in an outlet taking several hours at least to fully charge. When charging with electrical outlet, there is no green light, just the blue ones flashing until it is full.

CHARGING IN SUNLIGHT
Forget it. This is ridiculously horrible when it comes to solar charging. I have had this charging for DAYS in the light and it stays at the same level of stored power. When the sunlight is charging it, there is a green light lit.

CAN YOU CHARGE MORE THAN ONE ITEM AT THE SAME TIME?
I have charged both a bluetooth speaker and a Motorola Power phone at the same time. One is mini USB and the other is Type C. They charged up well, although they were slower than if one item at a time was charging.

POWER DRAW
When using this bank full to charge up 2 cell phones and a large speaker, there was still half a power bank full of charge left.

FLASHLIGHT
Although I usually don't use things like this for light, in an emergency it is handy to have. This is a very bright light.

THE BOTTOM LINE
I love this power bank for the attached plugs, the nice amount of power it has, and the bright light. The solar part is a fail for me. I would hate to depend on this in an emergency.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. This is fabulous without the solar panel. I have to take a star off for the solar panel being almost silly in my experience. It really is not worth listing in features as it does very little.

title: I LOVE This Cord With My Fast Charger
text:
I recently got a new phone so I needed a new charger cord for the car. I wanted something rugged so I could leave it in the car. It does not have the retractable coil my last one had which was a bit nicer, but it still does the job.

IS IT STURDY?
This is a well made cord that is sturdy and very flexible but strong.

CONNECTIONS
The connections are solid and stay into the charger on the USB side and the phone on the type C side.

DOES IT WORK WELL?
I have had a great result using this with my super fast charger. It charges my phone quickly and without any issues.

CORD WRAP
I have go to say as little as it is, the cord wrap that stays on this cord is one of my favorite features. I can wrap it up and keep it that way until I need it. I don't lose the twist ties, and it is easy to do. This is a great feature.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This great cord is strong, works well, is rugged and also has an attached cord wrap that is hook and loop that I LOVE.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is a winner for me. I love this cord. Especially that cord wrap.

title: Take Care Of This And Check Often - It Works So Far
text:
One thing that I have wanted to have was a security bag to protect devices from problems of hacking, or even possible Elecromagnetic Pulse which can be natural or not. Having a bag big enough can be a challenge. This one seems like a good start.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
WHAT FITS IN THERE?
This bag fits my full sized laptop, tablet, several phones and cards.

HOW TO CLOSE?
You have to roll the top down twice and it has hook and loop tape to hold it shut.

DOES IT WORK?
I tested it repeatedly with various devices and in every case it worked well.

TAKE CARE
This bag needs to be cared for- don't throw it around and keep it flat and store it without creases in it- roll it up if you have to store it for a period of time and this will last a while. Over time it can break down, so test it from time to time.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a great faraday bag for traveling or at home if you are concerned about blocking signals to your devices. It is lightweight, easy to use, and works so far.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS so far. I like this bag and am glad to have it. I needed a larger bag as my other one was too small and ended up with my son.

title: This Thing Is AWESOME!  I Use Indoors And Outdoors With Canon G12 Camera
text:
I have to take a lot of photos for products as well as artwork and subjects that I want to use for artwork. Having a nice tripod which is adaptable for various situations is important. This one fills a void I had for a flexible tripod.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
If you know camera stuff, this package won't faze you at all. If you are new to the whole world of photography, this set might seem to be a bit rough at first. Hang in there. Everything comes in a small thin box. The instructions are sparse and not overly well written, but they do help.

TRIPOD
The tripod has very flexible strong legs that can be bent into a number of positions. This is set up to do photos in any direction and the ball that controls direction is able to be locked into place easily so it won't move once you get it centered.

WHAT KIND OF CAMERAS?
This can be used with a traditional camera, phone camera, and a GoPro camera. It comes with the attachment for Go Pro separately but the other unit on the tripod stays closed for regular camera, and for a phone cam, you open the support and it can be adjusted to fit your phone.

WHAT I USE THIS FOR
I use this for my G12 Camera from Canon. In some shots I even use a screw on light on the top of the camera which is about the size of a smart phone. I take shots indoors and out of products, artwork, and subjects for art that I want to do in the future.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
I am really amazed at how well this tripod adapts to any position I put it through. It stays put pretty well and as long as it is somewhat balanced, it will keep my camera and light (which can be top heavy) very steady and I don't have any problems with it tipping or moving. In short this is GREAT for what I need it for.

REMOTE?
I don't use this for a cell phone camera, so I can not comment on that.

GO PRO?
I do not have a GoPro so I can not comment on that either.

ACCESSORIES?
There is a screw in spot for adding accessories to this camera. I am thinking perhaps a microphone, or other items you might want to have handy for whatever camera you are using.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This tripod is very portable and goes with me when I want to catch some good photos outdoors for artwork, and indoors when I want to do product photos. It stays put even when I put my large light on the top of it and I can shoot with the camera is almost any position.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is just what I wanted. It is great to have the options of standing on a surface or wrapping around a pole if I want. It is a great tripod and I love it so far.

PHOTO
I would take a photo of this for you but my camera is not working well on my phone and well, the camera is ON the tripod so I can not take a photo of it on there for you to see.

title: Great For Traveling
text:
I have a need for a power bank when we go on certain trips with my husband and I. Sometimes bringing all of the cords is a hassle, and other times power banks seem cumbersome to lug with me. However, this one is a bit of a different type which I like so far. Let's take a look.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This charger is pretty small. I would say it is the size of a pack of cigarettes or so. It has two cords on it for either Apple recharging, or C charging for phones and there is also a regular USB port on it which allows for other charging of devices.

PLUG
There is a fold out plug in the back for walls which is not polarized so you can put it in the outlet either direction.

BATTERY
You can press the battery button at any time to find out what kind of charge you have left.

CHARGING TIME
I have had this power bank charge up totally in as little as 40 minutes. For me, that is pretty quick. It might go faster for others, but I was amazed how quickly it charged up to full.

DOES IT GET HOT?
This does get pretty hot when charging from the wall outlet. Be aware of that when you use it. It won't burn you but it is a bit startling the first time you use it.

HOW WELL DOES IT WORK?
I have had to use this with my phone that is no a type C charge for now due to a problem with the phone I got this for. It has worked well using the USB port with my cord, and I got several charges from it. My other phone is more of a rapid charge and more demanding so I can not comment on that until I get a new one powered up again.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This is a great little power bank to travel with. It has the capacity to charge up Apple, Type C, and regular USB devices. I love that it has a fold out plug in it for the wall making it easy to quickly charge up when needed. It is small and easy to transport too.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS so far. With my older phone it is working great. Once I get my newer phone working again I will try to remember to update as for how well it works and how much battery drain changes if at all.

title: Works Great With My High Capacity Charging Cord and Regular USB Diffuser For The Car
text:
I recently got some new devices which require a C charging port. Yet, we have another device or two that we like bringing in the car which requires a regular USB port (such as diffuser). This charger solves the issues.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This charger is pretty straightforward. It fits into the cigarette lighter spot on the car. I have a Toyota Avalon and it fits perfectly with no issues. The C port is on top and the regular USB 3.0 is on the bottom. I am able to charge my phone (C port) at the same time I am running my diffuser (USB 3.0 port) which is fabulous. That makes me quite happy.

HOW DOES IT FIT?
The sockets so far have been a very tight fit and I am glad that they are not loose.

DOES IT CHARGE FAST?
So far, I have gotten good quick charging out of it. When I take a trip for an hour or so, my phone is charged by the time I reach my destination as long as I don't stop for a while which cuts the charging because my car turns them all off when not running.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This charger has solved my problem of how to use my C charging phone with my USB devices which need to have the 3.0 socket. It works well and so far I am happy with it.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I also love that this is bright colored on the sides to it is easy to find along with the purple cord I got to go with it.

title: Not For Daily Use (Unless Near Water) But Handy To Have On Many Occasions
text:
My husband has a history of crazy damage to cell phones. He got a job near a lake and considering that he just accidentally shut his phone in the hood of his car (yep, it's toast) I wanted to be sure his phone has protection from water since he is working near a lake. As a contractor you have to be prepared for a variety of situations.

WHAT IS THIS CASE LIKE?
This case is a really big case. It will fit a larger phone and fits the Moto G7 Power fine and can probably go slightly wider too. The case has a back window in it so that the camera can take pictures- although why you would want to do that through plastic I don't understand- and the front is completely see through.

ELASTIC
There is an elastic band which holds the phone up against the front window. There is still some space however, so the plastic is not very tight against the whole surface.

ZIPPER
The zipper is definitely waterproof and is a silicone track. They say to lube it with zipper lube from time to time, but don't say what kind.

LANYARD
This comes with a lanyard which allows you to keep this around your neck for easy access. That is a really cool feature if you are camping, or doing outdoor activities. You can have access for quick photos, and still keep it where you can see it.

BELT LOOP
The belt loop on this allows for a maximum of a 1 inch belt. It is very tight.

DOES THIS FLOAT?
Yes, this does float. If you happen to drop it in the water, it will float for a time so you can find it.

WHAT IS THIS GOOD FOR?
This is good for those who work outdoors, are going to have to work in the rain for a long period of time, who are working near water, who are camping , doing outdoor activities, and anyone who needs to be sure their phone is protected from water damage.

WHO MIGHT NOT LIKE THIS?
My husband did not think this was convenient. It is usable through the plastic, but he felt like it was awkward. He is doing most of the work on a cottage and not in or close to the water, but he has to refill buckets of water since the water is not working in the cottage.

So, I would say if you are not going to be in danger of water submersion this might seem cumbersome to you.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you are working through water, heavy rains, around bodies of water, or are busy in outdoor activities like camping, etc, this phone case would probably be a great thing to have. Those activities are not phone centered, so just having the phone protected is a great asset. If you want to just have protection against water but use your phone constantly, this might seem cumbersome to you.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. This is a great idea. For camping and activities outdoors where you just want your phone handy, but not used constantly, this is a FIVE STARS item. If you are using your phone a lot and want it handy to be protected from rain, this will still work well, but you might find it a bit clumsy. FOUR stars is for that kind of use.

title: Perfect For Contractor Husband- Fits Samsung Moto G7 Power Phone
text:
My husband just had to replace his contractor phone because he accidentally left it on the open motor area of the car, and the person he was with didn't see it and when they slammed the lid down.. OUCH. No phone. His new phone is much bigger. It is a Moto G7 Power. Let's see how this worked out.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
BELT LOOP
This has a great strong stiff belt loop that you slip a belt through. It is tight, but that also means that it is not going to shift all over the place as you work.

CARD SLOT
There is a front card slot so if you have to bring a card or two with you, it will fit in there.

PEN BAND
There is an elastic band that you can use to put a pen in. You have to be sure it is a good fit, or it will slide out.

COVER
The cover is stiff and flips down pretty tightly with magnetic closure.

FIT
This has elastic on the sides so that even if the phone is a tight fit, it will ease in easier than if it was non-stretch fabric.

WILL IT KEEP PHONE SAFE?
This will keep the phone safe. My husband is rough on things. He has had this work out pretty well for him. Even if he hits the flap wrong, the phone still stays put in the case. The inside is soft so there won't be damage, but the construction of the case is tough and will withstand hard use.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For my husband who does contract work, this is a great phone case. It lets him keep his phone close to him but also keep it safe. He likes it a lot and is thankful for having a good case that holds his phone safe and tight.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. This is a great case and fits my husband's phone perfectly. I am thinking of getting another for my phone in the future.

title: Perfect When An Outlet Is Not Available Or Power Outages
text:
Sometimes we just can not help it. Our phones or other devices need to be run and there is either no outlet available, or perhaps it is during a power outage. This little power bank is helpful.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This power bank comes with a charging cord to re-charge it so it is ready to go. It also comes with the power bank. There are bars on the outside of the bank to show when it is full and how close to empty it is getting. There is an on/off button so that the power bank does not lose power if you are not using it.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
This is a great little power bank. I was doing some work in a room without any outlets and wanted to hear some programs from my tablet and bluetooth speaker while working. My tablet was out of juice and I quickly brought this in, plugged in my tablet and was able to run my tablet four six hours without any problem. When done, the power bank still had two bars left.

IS THIS EASY TO CARRY?
The size of this makes it easy to carry with you traveling or into places where you need to not have a heavy duty power bank. It is nice and small. However, the power button on the front is easy to push, so you have to be sure to keep it in a container that won't allow accidental power button pressing.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This easy to see, easy to carry power bank is just enough for days when you need a boost to your phone or tablet. It works well and is small in foot print too.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. I love having this available. We get power outages and with all of the items we have that use this type of power it is great to have these around the house for those type of situations as well as where there are no outlets available. Two days is a conservative amount of time, I would say it would be close but not quite depending on what you are doing with the power bank.

title: Great Red Color And Solid Performance Have Been A GREAT Help To The Family
text:
We have had some issues with power outages in our area this year. That means that if you did not remember to charge your phone, and you have to go somewhere, it could be trouble. Yeah, I know there are car chargers, but in the case of kids who do not drive, there is not that option. Let's see how this helped out..

WHAT IS THIS POWER BANK LIKE?
This power bank is lighter weight than others we have, but it still packs a punch. It is red in color, which I LOVE because if you have to carry it in a purse or carry bag, it is easy to find in a darkened bag. It has two USB ports and a mini USB port as well as a mini USB charging port. There is a button on the side which tells how much power is left by lighting up a digital read out for a brief moment.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
First of all, the first charge only had to be a couple of hours, which surprised me. Clearly it was not empty when we got it. Once charged, our daughter had a sudden trip she had to take and we could not charge anything at home. She has a small portable charging battery, but it only gives about 20 minute of talk time and it does not work that well. I gave her this and she went off to her destination.

Upon her return, she told that she got a full charge on her phone and this pack still had 92% left on it! It is small enough to carry in a purse and she loves it. I have to pry it away from her sometimes when one of us wants to use it.

BATTERY CHARGE
This has a great standing time- goes down very little- and even when used for charging phones, we get quite a few out of it before we have to recharge.

CHARGING TIME
We have to recharge this at least overnight and sometimes well into the next day for a full charge on the battery pack.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a great battery pack to help with traveling and power outages, this has been a great help to take with us on trips, on sudden calls to jobs, or other things during power outages or if we simply forgot to charge the phone. We don't tend to use it for larger items like tablets, but it should work on that too.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. The red color and good solid performance make this one of our favorites in our house, despite having a few others to choose from. This one usually is the first to be chosen.

title: We LOVE This Thing- Great For Travel Or Teens, and FANS IN POWER FAILURES
text:
One of our daughters has had to stay and house sit at a variety of homes as well as catch rides to and from work since she does not have a license to drive yet. We have run into problems with phones not being able to be charged due to the constant relocation. We tried one power bank, but she didn't like it. Then we found this one..

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This is about twice the size of a pack of cigarettes. It is black and has a silver screen on it which will display percentage left of power so you never have to worry about not knowing when it is near empty. There are three ports- a type C and two out USB ports. There is also a charging port which is the small mini USB and it comes with the charging cord.

HOW LONG DID IT TAKE TO CHARGE?
This took about four hours or so to charge fully, but we have only had to charge it once as we only use it in emergencies for charging phones.

WHAT DID WE USE IT FOR?
We took this on a hiking trip and also have given it to our daughter to take with her when she is on the road a lot with her various relocations of house sitting. This has come in VERY handy. It is a bit heavy but she loves it and gladly puts it in her purse so she always has a charge.

We have also used this to charge up a personal fan which has a great air output. It was during a power outage and with no fan it was frustrating. I remembered we had this and charged it up and felt so wonderful to know that even without electricity we still had access to a fan!

HOW DID IT WORK?
She has gotten five charges out of this power bank so far before it has to be recharged. She usually does not do a full phone charge however, so it might be less on an empty phone.

ANY PROBLEMS?
There have been no problems with this power bank, other than it being black which makes it hard to find in a purse, backpack, or other storage if it is dark. That is a small problem, however. It works great.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For travel, day trips, and having emergency backup for using during power outages or being in an area with no electricity, this power bank has been invaluable to us. We love the security of being able to give it to our children when they need to be sure and have phone access at all times to catch rides or make arrangements with us.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS. Love this thing and we trade off with this and another we have. We get a lot of power failures and with all of the rechargeable fans and such we have, it is helpful in summer to be able to charge one up so we at least have something to keep cool with!

title: Great Tripod Goes From Tall To Shorter, Not Overly Stable But Good
text:
One of my children and I have decided to take a lot of pictures for a small business we are starting up. That requires that we have a variety of methods to take photos with. We have been using this tripod for some of them. Let's take a look.

WHAT IS THIS TRIPOD LIKE?
LEGS
Each leg can individually be set into different positions and heights. Each leg has three lengths on them for different positions.

WEIGHT HOOK
There is a bottom hook on the tripod.

LEVEL AND CAMERA PLATFORM
There is a level on top (bubble level) so that you can make sure that the platform that the camera sits on is level. There is a sliding piece which you put onto your camera that makes it easy to slide it onto the tripod each time you use it.

The top platform that the camera sits on has a ball joint that you can lock into place so that the camera can be put into a wide variety of angles. The top section screws off from the bottom legs.

CENTER POLE
The center pole can also be pulled up in length leaving the legs short or longer if you want. There is also a carry handle.

EXTRAS
This comes with an extra bolt and a tool for tightening the bolts/screws in a nice little bag that you can hang on the tripod when not in use.

HOW DOES THIS PERFORM?
We have had a great experience with this tripod. Although it does not always stand as stable as we would like, most of the time it is pretty easy to adjust and use. It is easy to rotate the camera and lock it into place. The camera stays put nicely and the bottom slider stays put well too. I know that we can put a weight on the center hook to hold the tripod into place, but we have not found the right one yet for us.

PORTABLE?
This is very portable and not too difficult to carry.

QUALITY?
This is a very nice quality item. We like it a lot.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a good quality tripod with a lot of versatility, this was a good choice for us. It is not always as stable as we would like, but we have not found a weight to use with it yet that we like, so once we do, perhaps this will be even better!

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. This tripod has been great so far. The quality is really nice and once we get a weight, if that solves the stability problem, I will update. At this point, it is more like four and a half, but I can only do whole stars, so for now it is four.

title: FANTASTIC For Doing Photos In Wide Variety Of Places-Can Use For CAMERA!
text:
We have recently started to do photos for a website so we have had a need to have a variety of tripods to help us get good shots of products and settings. Let's see how this one measures up.

WHAT IS THIS TRIPOD LIKE?
This tripod comes with three parts. There is the tripod which is three legs all jointed in multiple places. That allows you to pose and stand this in a variety of even or uneven places. There is a cell phone holder that screws into the top. There is also a remote to use with the cell phone so that you can snap a photo via bluetooth and don't have to press the phone to do it.

HOW DOES THE REMOTE WORK?
This remote is nice. You can wear it around your neck so you don't misplace it. You hook it up to a tablet or phone and it does snap photos very well. I had no problem pairing it. It will disconnect from the cord so you can keep it in your hand. When you are done with it, you snap it back on to the neck cord.

CELL PHONE HOLDER
This will hold medium to small cell phones. If you want to use it sideways or upright, you can. It does not fit tablets, but you can use the remote without the tripod if you want to. You can NOT use this with a case on your cell phone- it has to be taken out of the case to fit in the holder.

TRIPOD
This tripod is wonderful. There is a little plastic piece with a screw in it. You take that out of the tripod, screw it into what you want, and then slide it into the right place and it clicks into place. There is a button release. The stand has silicone on it to hold the camera steady. You have to have a quarter or other flat head screwdriver or similar implement to tighten the screw as it does not come with that tool.

The legs of the tripod can be formed in a variety of shapes so that even if you are on uneven terrain, you can stand it up.

LEG GRIPS
This has leg grips on it so that it does not slide out of place once it is set up.

SWIVEL?
This swivels once the camera/phone is installed on the tripod allowing for all sorts of photos.

IS THIS STURDY?
This tripod is very sturdy. We have used it a lot for table top photos as well as outdoor set ups. In each location it worked very well.

CAN THIS HOLD A REGULAR CAMERA?
YES! We screwed in our rather large FUJIFILM Finepix S1 camera and it worked like a dream. The remote did not work with it, but that was not an issue. We also tried it with my Canon G12 camera and it worked really well.

BEST USES
We use this more for camera use than cell phone. We love the way that it works with the camera. It holds VERY steady and does not tip or move easily at all. The way you do it is to screw the platform into the camera, and snap it onto the tripod and you are ready to go.

THE BOTTOM LINE
This tripod is WAY nicer than we expected. We love it for camera work and it is perfect when we need to get closeups on table tops or uneven terrain outside. This is a MUST have for us and we are very glad to have it.

MY RATING
FIVE Enthusiastic stars for this tripod set. It is fantastic. It is so small it is easy to transport. We really love this and use it constantly.

title: Works Great Need To Have Longer Cord For It
text:
When my husband lost his car charger, I was so excited, I ran and got this and shoved it at him to test out. He has his own business, so it is necessary for him to be able to answer the phone even if it is charging (it charges with the car not running as well as running). Let's see how this worked out for him.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This is a slim line charger that is almost like a thumb drive. It has two USB connections in it - one is 2.0 and the other is 3.0, but they are color coded so that you can easily see at a glance what you are dealing with. The one end fits into the lighter socket, and the other two ends are on the flat side of the charger.

HOW WAS IT TO USE?
We needed the 2.0 socket for the phone that my husband has, so he used that one. The cord we got is a long braided cord. The reason is that if his phone has to charge and he has a business call, he prefers to be able to talk on the phone and leave it charging. This combo worked out perfectly for him. The cord is about four feet long or so. We even tested two devices charging and it worked well (tablet and phone).

HOW FAST DID IT CHARGE?
My husband has had it on for a half hour drive on an almost dead phone. The phone was almost fully charged in each case. He is very happy with it.

EASY TO FIND
Another thing about this charger is that it is easier to find that the black ones that can get lost in a pocket, purse, or holder. The purple white colors stand out and it is much easier to locate. We also have a purple cord to match and that adds to the ease of finding when it is on.

THE BOTTOM LINE
For a compact charger that is colorful and easy to find, you get two options for charging two devices. With a longer cord it worked really well for my husband so he could answer the phone if necessary while charging in the car.

MY RATING
Five stars. This seems to be a really good solid charger. Having two connections is great as an option.

title: I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS STYLUS!  There I said it.
text:
When it comes to things like a stylus, honestly they all kind of area annoying. Perhaps it is because I have been privileged to be able to use the Wacom Professional pens for so long, I just am not that impressed with most styluses I have used over time.. until now..

WHAT IS THIS STYLUS LIKE?
This stylus is a very sleek smooth metal stylus. It has an on button on the side, a plug in micro USB recharging port on the end, and a teeny tiny light that tells you if it is charging or if it is on. There is a cord that comes with it (pretty short so be sure you have a place to sit it while charging), a carrying case out of thin fake leather, and it all comes in a nice little presentation box- perfect for gift giving.

HOW DOES THIS WORK?
This took only a couple of hours to fully charge when I got it. The .light was red until it was charged. The tip is plastic. On the tip you can turn it either way to increase or decrease sensitivity.

HOW DID THIS PERFORM?
I use the original sketchbook Pro which I purchased before Sketchbook made their software freeware. When I used this stylus with that software- OMG the control it has! I could do very tiny work, very detailed work, and had control and precise performance I have not seen with an Android compatible stylus yet! I really love it.

ANY COMPLAINTS?
There is one (always one, isn't there) complaint I have. The pen itself is very slippery. That is easily solved, however, by putting a pencil holder on it - you know one of those silicone grips? The other thing is that the indicator light is so minuscule that you have to really look for it to see if it is on or not.

THE BOTTOM LINE
If you are looking for precise stylus control that works well with Android art apps, this might be a great one to try. Adjustable sensitivity, it has given me some really great control in my artwork. It is my favorite stylus to date. It did not scratch my screen at all either.

MY RATING
FIVE stars. If I have any reason to provide more information, I will update in the future.

title: Depends On What You Use It On As To How Well It Works
text:
I have a variety of touchscreens that I like to use for my art projects. That means I need a stylus. Let's see how this one measured up.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This stylus has a recharge port on it. It comes with a recharge cable that plugs into USB. It has a power button which lights up blue when you use it. It has a rubber tipped cap on it and you can unscrew it to a fine point like a pen.

WHAT DID I USE THIS WITH AND HOW DID IT PERFORM?
I used this with:
SAMSUNG S2 TABLET
With this it worked flawlessly on my tablet using the old Sketchbook Pro app. I could use it and it would react relatively well with slight pressure sensitive movements, although it was not as nice as a Wacom pen with tablet is. As a point and click, it worked beautifully too. I am not sure if it was the app programming or the tablet itself that made the difference.

ACER 2 in 1 Model N16P2 (Aspire R15)
When it came to using this with sketchbook which is now a free app for Windows, it was AWFUL. This stylus skipped like crazy. It worked as point and click, but it was not as dependable as it was on my tablet. Again, this software has been changed for Windows, so I am not sure if this was a problem with the software or the 2in1. I lean more toward the device and perhaps software combined.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Depending on what you use this with, it might work well, or it might skip on some devices or with some versions of software.

MY RATING
FOUR STARS. I love how it works on my tablet, but it is unusable on my laptop 2 in 1 as a tablet. I am not sure what the difference is, but if I discover a fix, I will update my review.

title: IF THIS CAN MAKE IT THROUGH MY HUSBAND IT CAN MAKE IT THROUGH ANYTHING
text:
(WARNING- This is an in depth review designed to help anyone interested in making a sincere buying decision. If you prefer a short summary, see section marked THE BOTTOM LINE near the end of the review.)

When it comes to phones, well, electronic devices in general, if it is going to break or malfunction, my husband will bring it out of them. He is a contractor and runs his own business, so having a phone that works and is tough without interruption of malfunction or frustration is a MUST. I waited an extra long time after getting this phone to have him use it just to see how it would stand up. Let's see how this phone worked out for him.

WHAT PHONE WAS HE USED TO USING?
The phone that he used previously was a Motorola Moto G3 with Android updated to the most current level equal to this phone at the time that he started using this phone instead.

WHAT IS THIS PHONE LIKE?
First thing I had a hard time convincing him of was that he could not get a case for this phone. It is built so that it does not need a case, the phone itself is sealed and put into a strong case with strong screen. I am going to break down the features into different sections labeled so you can find out what you want to know more easily:

INSTRUCTION BOOK
Very well laid out, this instruction book makes the phone very easy to learn even for someone who has no experience with cell phones before. It also has a good layout so that someone who is familiar with cell phones can find what they need to know quickly and easily.

BACK CASE
This is a strong back case on this phone. It is meant for heavy duty use and claims to be water resistant/proof. I never say anything is truly water resistant, but that is what is on the literature.

FRONT GLASS
Not at all fragile looking, this works well and is very sensitive- he had to turn down the sensitivity a bit.

VOLUME UP/DOWN
The right side of the phone as you look at it has the volume up button on top and a SEPARATE BUTTON for volume down. This makes it easy in one respect because you are not mistakenly pushing it the wrong way. On the other hand, there are two buttons on each side which in a hurry is easy to mistake which side you are supposed to use and results in turning the phone into a sleeping/soft off position.

POWER and PROGRAMMABLE
The two buttons on the opposite (left) side as you look at the front of the phone are the on and off button and the programmable button.

PROGRAMMABLE BUTTON
This is a really cool feature. You can set the programmable button to manage incoming calls, do a Google search, or use the flashlight. You can also use the PTT (push to talk) service with this button if you so choose.

SIM CARD
There is capacity for two sim cards- a regular and nano sim. They will both work, but only one will support 3g/4g service. The other will support 3G only. There is a waterproof "cap" that presses into place over this area to protect it from water damage if it is in properly.

MICRO SD CARD
This card goes into a slot and locks in with a waterproof door covering it if you are sure it is in tightly. You can use up to 128MB size Micro SD card.

FUNCTION BUTTONS
This is one of his favorite features- they are actual BUTTONS. No more pressing the screen for his functions. They are solid well built buttons that are easy to press and use.

TRANSFER OF INFORMATION FROM OLD TO NEW PHONE
This was such an easy task it was almost unbelievable. Information transferred quickly and perfectly. We were impressed at how well the set up of the phone went.

CALLS
Calls are easy to do. The call quality is excellent and the performance is as good (or better) at times as the Moto G3 which was a solid performing phone that gave the best performance of any phone we have ever used, including the "high end" phones.

VOLUME
The volume of the phone is good. Speaker phone is not always as loud on the other callers end, but on the end of the user, it is good. It is still possible to hear in a rather noisy van, but challenging. Ear phone or wireless speaker would be a better choice if you plan to use this regularly in a truck or van.

MUSIC
My husband uses his phone a lot for music- either from the Micro SD card or from FM radio. Reception is great and he is very surprised at how well this phone plays music from either radio or Micro SD. I have to say that I thought he was using a speaker the other day. When I saw it was just his phone, I really was impressed!

INTERNET PERFORMANCE
This works a bit nicer than his previous phone when it comes to internet usage. When having to use GPS, internet search, or find other information, this phone performs very well.

SCREEN VIEW
This screen is amazing. Crystal clear, beautiful color, and excellent definition make this phone a pleasure to use. I take his phone now and then to make a call because it is such a pleasure to use and view the screen.

DURABILITY
This is a solid phone. Honestly, it is one of the most rugged phones I have used, including the Rugby which was the most rugged we have used previous to this. The performance is great, the visual is wonderful, and the size is not cumbersome or too dainty either. I would say that if dropped in water, or left out in the rain (which has happened to this phone) will not damage the phone as long as it is not a severe abusive situation. (Like shooting it from a missle launch into the ocean, maybe? HAHA)

SENSITIVITY
This phone has a glove mode. That means that you can set it to be more sensitive on those days you have to work with gloves on. This feature works great although at times, he sets it and forgets it and tends to mute everyone he is talking to until he sets it back again (by just putting the phone up to his face- it mutes people)

BATTERY
With constant daily use, my husband only has to recharge this like every five or six days depending on how heavily he is using it for music and other tasks. It charges pretty quickly too.

ANY CAVEATS?
My husband has a tendency to do and undo things and have no idea how he did it. He is all about doing the jobs and getting them done, but when it comes to phones and computers, well, he is a bit of a Magoo at times. Other times he is a real pro. I guess it depends on whether his mind is on a job he is doing or if he can put more brain power into thinking about his phone. Yes, he has erased his fish pond wallpaper, muted people he is talking to, and managed to dial someone by mistake multiple times, but other than that, this phone has the best record of NOT allowing him to make mistakes of any I have seen so far.

HOW LONG HAS HE BEEN USING THIS PHONE?
I think we have had this about five or six months now, so he has been putting it through a lot in that amount of time. It is still in wonderful shape and performing beautifully at the time of this review.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Waterproof (if sealed properly) with extra features for contractors, this phone is one tough phone. It has held up beautifully for five or six months now, has excellent visual clarity and solid performance and is PERFECT for my contractor husband who is VERY rough on phones.

MY RATING
FIVE STARS for this one. I am very impressed at how well it has held up, but also how fool proof it has been for my husband who is notoriously rough on phones.

title: Just Didn't Work Out Well For Anyone In Our Family (Various phones, various dashboards)
text:
When it comes to devices to hold phones, we have a variety of needs. This seemed like a good idea at the time. Let's see how it worked out.

WHAT IS THIS LIKE?
This device comes with a clear plastic cover on the bottom. You remove the bottom and it sticks to the dashboard or desktop of your choice. Then there is a lever that you press which forms a suction on the bottom that is supposed to hold it in place. The clip for the phone opens on the right side and slides out with a spring action. It does swivel 360 degrees to change the way you see the screen.

HOW DID THIS PERFORM?
Wow, what an experience this was for us. We tried this in a few cars, but none of them had a good place to put it. Then we tried it on one that it appeared to fit on and it stuck, but then it seemed to wobble a bit, even with the suction enacted. The real frustration with this was that the phone that this particular driver in our family uses for that car is a Moto Eplus. That means that the clip is hard to use because not only is it easy to hit the buttons by accident, but it also does not have a firm hold on the phone. It seems to slip a bit.

After using this for a while, we decided to remove it from the car. It was becoming a hassle and frustration. When removed, the dash was a bit sticky so we used some goo remover to get it off.

THE BOTTOM LINE
Designed for phones that do not have a case, this holder just didn't work out for us. It did not fit well on the dash of two cars and the third that it did fit in did not give safe performance for driving. The idea is that we want to drive without distraction and this was not it. It left sticky residue when removed too.

MY RATING
Two stars. Perhaps the perfect car, dash, and phone would work well with it, but it just didn't work out well for anyone in our family.

title: UPDATED OCT 4, 2016- THEY FIXED IT!  See Beginning of This For Happy Update (Left Old Parts Up In Case You Were Interested)
text:
OCT UPDATE
I am happy to say after quite a few weeks of testing that the problem with the hands free unit was addressed. It is not perfect as of yet, but it has the capacity at the time of this update. Google has provided some kind of voice recognition for dialing, although it has a tendency to make a lot of mistakes, it still does work. So, when I need to call someone for an important call, most of the time the unit will work, despite a few frustrations here and there.

As for the phone itself, let me say that friends and family have other brands of phones in this category and they are not as nice as this one is. It picks up calls where others won't. I don't think I have had more than a couple of dropped calls since we have owned them, and that is a record for us! In areas where the cell coverage is not great, this phone will pick up signals before others in the same area will (that are with us at the time). It downloads and uploads information at a fast rate and really works beautifully almost all of the time with very few errors or frustrations. Updates are current and really good as well.

All in all, I now am RAVING about this phone. I really am glad we chose it. I thought it would be best to include this update at the beginning and if you want to read the rest of my previous review for more info on the experiences prior to this, you can.

EXCELLENT PHONE!

UPDATE IS FIRST SEE ORIGINAL REVIEW AT END
I first wrote this review because I was very upset that the new changes updated to my phone (which said Marshmallow and S'more at the time it was updating) left me without the ability to use my voice activated dialing and answering features on my hands free speaker for phones in my car. Since I use that feature 90% of the time that I use my phone, to me it is a BIG deal. That, of course, is due to the software update, not the phone itself at this point.

The review about that is following this- my newest impressions of this phone. I am expounding upon what I have experienced SINCE writing the review I started with and will eventually update to a more detailed and orderly review as I get to experience more and more of the phone over time.
----------
Because I am not a smart phone expert, I am not sure which of the following features are due to the "marshmallow/s'more" updates that were applied to the phone, or just the phone itself.

WHAT I LIKE ABOUT THIS PHONE
BLAZING fast speed when using data
Limits you can apply for data use when using the phone
Great response of the screen, even with a tempered glass cover on it
Quick response when dialing and using phone
LOUD speaker phone
Can hear very well when talking without speaker phone
People can hear me loudly when I use this phone
Screen clarity and saturation excellent
Microphone transcription of text messages works great
Wi Fi works great in any store or at home
Do Not Disturb feature

WHAT I DON'T LIKE ABOUT THIS PHONE
Inability to use voice activated dialing and answering with handsfree device
Hard to get used to after using the Rugby flip phone
Hanging up from a phone call can be challenging at times
Putting on speaker phone is too involved to be used fast
Should come with a printed manual

PHONE SERVICE I AM USING WITH THIS PHONE
Consumer Cellular

Again, I will update with a very orderly and coherent review of this phone the more that I get to use it. I just want to keep people updated for until I get a more orderly review to post with more details.

WE HAVE TWO PHONES- HOW MY HUSBAND'S EXPERIENCE IS SO FAR
Both my husband and I have these phones and he is one of the worst people on phones I have ever met. He is AWFUL. He is technically challenged and so rough physically I was worried as to how long this would last. So far, it has lasted a month for him. He loves it. It is easy for him to use which shocks me truly. The man has already dropped it many times and has broken the case that he bought for it, but the phone is still doing great.

More on that when I get a chance to update again and put some better order to this review.

----------------------------------------------
(FORMER REVIEW ORIGINALLY POSTED)
I don't normally write a poor review but right now, I think it is necessary.

I purchased the Moto G 3rd gen phone not too long ago after reading tons of reviews and write ups and all sorts of raves about this phone. There is one thing that I would have liked to know which is ESSENTIAL to me and if I had known this, I would not have purchased this phone.

Yes, this phone has nice screen, nice features, and works okay. For the price it is decent, EXCEPT THERE IS NO HANDS FREE VOICE RECOGNITION FOR DRIVING BUILT INTO THIS PHONE.

I have had phones which are ARCHAIC compared to this phone that have had voice recognition. That allows the phone to answer through a bluetooth device such as a speaker in the car.

I recently just discovered that the Moto Assist has been retired from the Marshmallow update so there are not any options for this phone to be used hands free while driving, so even the option that ate up data time is now gone.

That makes me very upset.

I could rave on about the other features of this phone, and perhaps to some of you that would be enough. However, in my situation, when I am driving, I like to be able to talk via bluetooth speaker phone in the car and not rake up huge data bills.

Any other app that we have tried does not work right with this phone, either.

I will update this review should I find an acceptable solution to this problem and if I decide to keep the phone. For now, I could care less about all of the fancy features of the phone when I can not use it for one of the essential tasks that I use constantly when driving.

UPDATE
I am waiting for something to change in Marshmallow, but I will take some time and update this review with my detailed observations of this phone as I continue to use it while NOT in the car driving. Other than the problem which is an Android problem, not Motorola (although their program that used to work no longer does for that purpose) I have found the phone to be a very decent budget phone compared to others I have used.

I will update soon as I can to reflect my other opinions on the phone. I did want to warn people right away about the current situation in case they were depending on this phone to use for hands free driving to call and answer via bluetooth speakers. If you have an older phone that will not update to Marshmallow, then you will probably be okay. I would wait for an upgrade if your current phone works fine with your bluetooth speakers in the car at least to use it for your phone at this point.

title: NOT the same color as shown online but still nice case
text:
I was so excited to have found a neon green case for my tablet that I couldn't wait for it to come. Well, the package came and the case is not the same color as shown online. The appearance of the photo is a NEON intense glowy green. The color of the actual case is a much more subdued grass green. It is okay, but I really wanted BRIGHT neon.

The case itself fits perfectly. All of the holes line up and it does stand up well when you fold the front back. The magnet on the front of the case is not very strong, however. It always feels like it is going to flip open.

The elastic strap for the stylus on the outside is nice, but if you want to get a nice stylus with a brush on it , I am not sure I like how easily it can fall out or get damaged from being on the outside there.

The lining is a soft microfiber type fabric and is a neutral gray color. The tablet is a little challenge to get in, but not bad at all once you get the hang of it. It is not like some of the straps that you have to force way too hard to get the tablet into place.

All in all it is a nice case, well constructed, and fits the tablet well. I took off a star because of the color issues and the placement of the stylus holder and the cover issues not closing as firmly as it could. I still recommend it for the Acer A1-230. It is a nice case.

title: Plantronics Usually Scares Me (Note: This Headset Is Not Just For Smart Phones)
text:
I have had a lot of Plantronics Bluetooth Headsets. All of them but one are dead. They frustrated me, left me without bluetooth capabilities in important situations, and caused me pain and frustration to no end. The only one that still works is the first one I ever saw- it is about five years old or so and only cost about $20 when I got it at the cell phone store.

I was not very optimistic about the M165 Marque 2 Ultralight Bluetooth Headset, but decided to try it anyway.

It is not quite a month old, but so far it is one of the nicer of the Plantronics that I have used, which is not saying much.

PROS
-WILL WORK WITH REGULAR CELL PHONES- not just smart phones.
-On/off switch. I love that you can turn off the ear piece without having to press the answer button
-Earhook- this holds the unit in place and is the ONLY reason I can even use it
-Voice - you can say ANSWER and it will answer, although it does not always work that easily

CONS
-No carrying case- this is too fragile to stick in your pocket or purse.
-Silicone ear piece- none of them fit me- completely painful and blocks hearing

Performance wise, people can hear me well and I can hear pretty well, but only because I took off the silicone cover from the ear mike and then let it sit right in my ear- it does not hurt that way. If I did not do that, I would not be able to use it. The ear hook is the only thing that keeps this on my ear, but it works great so far. The ear hook is small and works with or without glasses on. It is comfortable despite there being no silicone pads to help hold it in my ear canal.

I have yet to find Plantronics ear silicone pieces that fit in my ear canal- it is frustrating.

I can hear well with this set up and despite moving around a lot and trying to shake out my ear piece and it stays pretty well- unlike all of the other ear pieces. People can hear me well and I can hear them most of the time too.

Answering the ear piece is easy and although I have to repeat "ANSWER" sometimes to get it to answer with the voice activated feature it is still handy to have.

Another thing that I have noticed is that if I leave my phone in another room, I have up to about 20 feet away (including walls in the way not clear air space) before the ear piece gets too fuzzy to hear.

I want to point out again- this ear piece works well with NORMAL cell phones not just smart phones. I have a Samsung Rugby II and I was worried it would not work with this ear piece as all of the write ups that I saw seemed to indicate that it was for smart phones only with no mention of regular cell phones.

The question is- how long with this ear piece work? I have had so much trouble with Plantronics headsets not working for very long that I am skeptical about this unit as well and will edit as I find out. I have given this four stars because it does not fit unless I dismantle the silicone pads.

title: Not Perfect, But I Love This!
text:
The Jabra Freeway is one of the most handy little gadgets that I have used when it comes to bluetooth and cell phones. About the size of a half size of a paperback book, this speaker is really a handy little gizmo.

The set up is really easy as the instructions are audio and integrated in the unit. Each area of control on the unit is clearly marked and easy to access while driving. The volume button on the unit is easy to reach and easy to use. It is just sensitive enough so that it will work but not so easy that it is constantly being hit by mistake.

The phone button (looks like a receiver of a regular phone) is a little hard to see if you are looking for it, as it curves around back of the unit, but it is easy enough to find that you don't really have to look for it.

The voice commands are not always easy to use, however. I have tested this unit with two phones- both Samsung Rugby phones. When using the voice, you have to press the VOICE button on the unit, wait for it to tell you to "Say a Command" then say "Phone commands" then the Rugby says, "Say a Command" through the Freeway speaker and you have to tell it what to do. Sometimes I find that even though I am speaking clearly and saying exactly what needs to be said, the system gets messed up and I can not use the voice command again unless I reset the Jabra Unit, or sometimes I have to go back in and reset something on my phone.

For instance, I told the phone (via Jabra Freeway) to dial a number that I had been using with no problem before. Suddenly I was in some kind of research mode that I could not get out of. I am not sure what the problem is yet- if the phone is trying to override the speaker or what, but it is frustrating.

At that point, I have to shut the unit off and then turn it on again if I want to use voice commands on the Jabra Freeway unit.

When leaving the vehicle, the unit connection does shut off but the speaker still is technically on. It is best to turn it completely off at the end of the day, however, since it will stay charged longer.

Also, when it gets really hot (like 120 degrees in a sun baked car) or really cold, I would not recommend leaving this in the car- it is easy enough to remove and replace, however, so it is just a matter of making a habit of removing it from the car in extreme heat or cold.

Despite the frustration with having to reset on voice mode, if I just want to access the unit, I can easily press the buttons and use it that way until I turn the unit on and off again.

Sound quality is fantastic- people remark that they can not hear the wind hardly at all when my windows are open, and I can also hear very clearly when the volume is not up too high. In fact, sometimes I have to turn the volume down because people say I am talking too loud when I am barely speaking! This is a huge change from all of my ear pieces!

WHAT I LIKE
The voice commands are handy when they work.
Speaker works beautifully even with windows open
Controls are easy to access and clearly marked
Long talk time
Clear sound
Phone hooks up when entering car again
Will tell how much battery talk time is left when asked

WHAT I DON'T LIKE
Voice does not always work well
Sometimes have to reset phone when commands get mixed up
Runs phone down faster when leaving car and coming back through a day- looking for bluetooth connection- but the unit itself holds charge really well

Despite some limitations, I still absolutely love the Freeway and compared to the Blue Ant S4, it is much easier to use, and much more handy to have in the car. Compared to the Blue Ant S4, I find that the sound is similar, wind block is also similar, but the controls in the Blue Ant S4 frustrate me- they are hard to use and sometimes unresponsive. The Jabra Freeway is superior in that department. I like using it much better. And it definitely beats any of the Plantronics ear pieces I have tried to use in the car. I have gone through quite a few of them from the highest end to the most basic.

I will be using the Jabra Freeway from now on in the car as long as it performs well.

title: Very nice, but use care applying it
text: This screen protector is much nicer than I expected. It's nearly invisible, and the display looks just as nice as it did before. Even the few small scratches I had before putting this on are now invisible. However, it's a bit tricky to apply. Here are my hints -- hopefully this will be helpful. 1) Clean the screen very carefully and completely before applying the protector. 2) Make sure there's no dust remaining on the screen. 3) Carefully remove the first tab from the screen protector, and get ready to position it over the screen. 4) Align it along only one edge of the screen at first. 5) Carefully smooth out the screen protector, starting from the edge and continuing over the entire screen. The idea is to avoid trapping bubbles under the screen protector, this is easier if the screen protector goes on from one edge first. 6) Peel off the top protective layer from the screen protector. It took me a few false starts before I worked out this approach; the result works very well for me.

title: Really impressive value!
text:
I ordered the 'NUU Mobile X6-32GB + 3GB RAM LTE Android Unlocked Dual SIM Smartphone | 5.7" HD+ Display | Fingerprint | 13MP Camera' for review and would like to share my thoughts.

I ordered this to replace an older mobile phone that was handed down to my daughter some time ago and it was failing fast. I was initially really impressed for the money at all that this NUU mobile phone had to offer. I was concerned that it might not work with our T-Mobile service but it has proved to work much better than the phone that she was using that was actually made for the T-Mobile network. This phone has actually proved to be a very good phone for my daughter and has so far held up quite well. The screen is beautiful, the reception is fine and the 32gb capacity with the option of and SD card has worked nicely for her needs.
Usually I like to pay a little more to get a quality phone but after the experience with this phone, if I need to replace my much more expensive phone, I may consider this model for myself. Personally I have no need for a dual SIM card but the fact that this phone has that option as well makes it all the more a better value. Overall I think that for the money, you can't go wrong with this phone! I hope that this was helpful.

title: Simple, but functions for their purpose
text: I ordered a set of 5 'LUOATIP USB Wall Chargers' for review.  It seems we never have enough of these for all our electronics.  This 5 pack is reasonably priced and the dual USB ports on each one is a nice feature.  Our house does not seem to have enough wall plugs so having two ports on each charging block multiplies our charging ability times two.  They are simple, they are what they are, but overall, economically priced and we have not had any issues with the 5 that we ordered.

title: Accuracy just too off for functional use
text:
I had the opportunity to review the Active Stylus Pen for Apple Ipad, Digital Pencil iPad Series Rechargeable Pencil Touchscreen Precise Fine Tip' Stylus and would like to share my thoughts with you.
This stylus is very basic looking. The clip is metal but feels about as durable as the clips used on a ballpoint pen.
It is rechargeable with a USB. The top comes off and you put the usb into the port in the end of the stylus. The top of the stylus is magnetic and clicks into place and stays.
I would not classify the tip as a fine point, it is much larger than other Stylus tips that I have had the opportunity to use.
The accuracy is off when using it with my iPad touchscreen.
It is Bluetooth and connected without any issues.
It is lightweight and although that may be a benefit to this pen, it makes it feel a bit cheaply made.
Overall, this is not a stylus we will use again, nor would we purchase in the future. The lack of accuracy just made this stylus too hard to use.

title: Functionally works
text:
I had the opportunity to order and review a 6 pack set of Elimoons Phone Stands and would like to share my thoughts with you:
This set of 6 stands are brightly colored.
They are relatively thin and lightweight. Easily slips into a pocket or purse to take on the go.
They fold up and the back-stand piece slips into pre-made groves on the base so that you can adjust the angle.
The stand does not lock into place, rather just sits in the grooves.
There are four rubber dots on the back to help keep it from sliding around on a smooth surface.
Additionally, there is a rubber strip on the front cradle to help keep your phone from slipping.
Their quality is okay, but I do not think they will last long in the hands of my kids. As they are a thinner plastic, once stepped on they would most likely be done for.
For under $10, this set of six is reasonably priced. The quality meets the price point.
Overall, these will work for my kids when their hands are busy, and they want to watch a video or such. But I do not expect them to last long.

title: Economically priced
text:
I had the opportunity to review the elcase Air Bolster Clear Crystal Case for iPhone 11, Shock Absorption Anti-Scratch Drop Protection Protective Fit Slim Bumper Cover for iPhone 11 Case 6.1 inch (2019) in Matte Black. My daughter was willing to try it out on her iPhone 11 and I would like to share my thoughts along with hers.
My daughter thoughts:
That the case was too chunky. It did however, fit into her jeans pocket.
It did come up slightly and curved around the edges of the front for added screen protection, but she felt it came up too high, making it too wide.
In her opinion, she felt that it being completely clear it made her phone look weird (I know, but she is a teenager)
She had a difficulty putting the case on and taking it off, she felt it fit just a little too tight. It is in 2 parts, versus one.
My thoughts:
This case is crystal clear.
The cut-out lined up perfectly where they needed to be
It has a medium grip.
It is price is economical.
It does seem to protect the phone when it is dropped.
Overall, this phone functions well for it's purpose of protecting your phone. It's quality does meet the price point. My daughter was just not pleased with the size, aesthetic look and difficulty in getting it onto her phone. However, the aesthetics maybe more appealing to others.

title: Heavy, durable Charging Station
text:
I had the opportunity to order the Smatree Wireless Charging Station for Apple to review. I would like to share a few or my and my daughter's (She owns the Apple products in our home) thoughts:
This charger is heavy, well made, and stable when sitting on my night table. Would not make a good traveling or portable charging station as it is so heavy.
It charges IPods and Iphone very well and quickly. My daughters like having the ability to charge both at one time.
The front Phone stand has a moveable shelf so you can adjust it so the wireless charging port and the phone line up correctly with various sizes of phones.
Aesthetically, this Charging Station is sleek. The silver and white two tone is a nice combination.
This charging Station does not come with an IWatch charger. For the price of this charging station, I feel that it should be included. There is a place to insert the IWatch Charger.
Overall, this is a great looking and well-made charging port. Although, it does seem a bit on the higher end of the price scale, especially missing the IWatch charger.

title: Great quality and functionality
text:
I had the opportunity to review the Coolden Clear Protective Case for iPhone 11 Hybrid Designed Crystal Clear 3 in 1 Shock Absorption Bumper Anti-Scratch Back Cover for iPhone 11 6.1 Inch in Transparent. My daughter recently got the I-phone 11 and needed a case. We ordered two separate cases that were the exact same price for comparison. This case was her favorite. The below are some of her thoughts.
This case is not chunky at all, it slips easily into my jean's pockets.
I have dropped my phone a couple of times and it was fine.
The bumper sides comes up high enough and curves slightly around the screen to protect the glass. Although it does come up slightly, it is not too wide.
The texture of the case is smooth. The grip in her opinion was a medium. Your fingers do not slide easily when you run them across the back or sides.
It is a one-piece case that is easy to get on and off. Yet fits snuggly enough that dirt or accidental spills do not seep into the phone. Nor does the case just fall off.
She did not feel that it was waterproof. The I-phone 11 is waterproof, so it was a small detail she did not mind that the case lacked.
Everything aligned up precisely. No struggle to access any of the buttons or to insert the charger.
Although the case does come up slightly higher than the screen, she did not have any issue with the charging port being accessible or attaching the charger.
The back is crystal clear, has not scratched and she likes that she can put a picture between the phone and the case for display.
My daughter said she loved this case so much, she could not think of any cons. Overall, this a good quality phone case for a relatively inexpensive price.

title: Awesome Mic!
text:
I ordered the 'EACHSHOT Smartphone Phone Video Film Filmmaking Recording Microphone Kit Filmmaker Mini Tripod with Shotgun Video Mic Video Rig for iPhone 11 Pro Max X 8 Plus 7 Plus Samsung Huawei etc.' for review.
I ordered this kit mainly for the Mic. It is an amazing little mic for the size and it works great with both my mobile phone and DSLR. The included dead cat that comes with the Mic is a bit tricky to put on as it is pretty snug but it's nice to have and works well for reducing wind noise. The Mic itself does not have any settings for volume, but those can be adjusted via the camera or editing software. The included mini tripod and phone mounts are just bonuses and both are of good quality. I do wish that the Mic would have come with a hard case to make it easier to just thrown in my bag and keep it more protected, but I am sure I can find something to use. Overall, I really like this kit and think it's worth it, just for the Mic.

title: Nice value.

text:

This Razer Arctech Pro rates right up there with some of the big case brands out there as far as protection and design.
