title: It works, and works well!!
text:
I ordered the 'Techsmarter 60W USB-C Power Adapter, Compact Type C PD Wall Charger Compatible with iPhone X, XR, XS, 11, iPad, MacBook, Samsung S8, S9, S10, Note 8, 9, 10, HP Spectre, Dell XPS, Latitude, Chromebook' for review.
I am always in need of Power Bricks and enjoy having extras to keep in my travel bags, office, bedroom ect. I loved the fact that this one is so versatile in the sense that it will pretty much charge anything as long as you have the USB C type plug or adapter. Fast charging has worked on all my devices that are capable and those that aren't, still charge at the rate they were designed to charge. If I were to have any complaints with this power brick, it would be there is only one charging port for the size, and that there is not an included cable. Now with that said, you are getting a quality power brick that does it's job perfectly for what I need. Overall I think this is a great value for the money for what it is and how well it performs.

title: Favorite Otterbox case of all.
text: I ordered the 'OtterBox Symmetry Series Case for Samsung Galaxy Note10+ - Black' for review already knowing that the Symmetry series is my favorite Otterbox case ever. I have owned it for other phone models and I have never been disappointed. The Note 10+ Symmetry model is no exception. The case fits perfectly with the cut-outs spot on. The grip is just right without being too slippery or overly sticky. Buttons function as they should with just the right amount of resistance. Drop protection is fantastic, though I refuse to actually test this with my new phone but as I said, I've had the Symmetry case before on other phones and they have been excellent protection in the past and this one should be no different.  Overall, if you are looking for the perfect case no matter what phone you have, the Symmetry Otterbox model should be one to look at!!

title: Super easy to install and adjusts to fit even my small wrist.
text: I ordered the 'YSSNH Genuine Leather+Stainless Steel Metal Quick Release 22mm Universal Watch Band, Strap Replacement for Samsung Galaxy Watch 46mm Samsung Gear S3 Classic/Frontier Smart Watch with 22mm Lug' for review and would like to share my thoughts. My wrists are small so it is very hard to find watch bands that will fit correctly. I had my doubts about this set but I was surprised to find that the metal band came with a tool that helps to remove link pins. This was so much appreciated as most replacement bands of this type do not come with this kits and suggest you buy one if you need to remove links. With this set there is no need. The tool was super easy to use and I was able to get the metal band adjusted to fit my small wrist in no time. Even the leather strap fits, though I am at the very last hole. But overall this set is very nice looking and fit well without looking awkward. Both bands are of nice quality materials and the included band pins are of good quality and are easy to install.

title: Ultimate protection!
text: I ordered the 'OtterBox Defender Series SCREENLESS Edition Case for Samsung Galaxy Note10+ - Black' for my Note 10+ to review. In my experience the Otterbox brand has always produced fantastic cases and this one does not disappoint. It fits perfectly and provides the maximum protection and with that said, it comes at a cost. In the Defender Series that cost is the fact that this thing is bulky. For those looking for the maximum protection for your mobile device, this would be the case to get but just know that it's going to ad a lot of bulk and if you don't' mind that then you need to look no further. Personally for me the Defender is just too much bulk to be my daily case driver however it will find a place in my case rotation. Protection is phenomenal, fit is perfect, buttons function as they should  and cut-outs are precise. Just know that even though it's big and bulky, it does have grip and is seriously a beast at protecting your investment.

title: Pretty much my go-to quick charger.
text: I ordered this 'USB C Wall Charger, Huntkey 45W Type-C Fast Charging Adapter for MacBook Pro, MacBook Air, iPad Pro New, HP, Dell, Lenovo, Samsung Galaxy and Other USBC Powered Devices, 6ft C-C Cable Included' for review. I needed a good quality quick charger that would work on not only my mobile phone but cordless portable chargers as well. This one has worked flawlessly for both. I have also used it to charge headphones and Bluetooth speakers with zero issues. Even devices that don't have quick charge capabilities still charge, as this device will step down to the max current your device will handle. The included USB C to USB C cable is really nice and thick. It's not like the flimsy generic cords you can get for a dime-a-dozen. Overall this is a solid quality built charging brick and cable and I think it has incredible value!

title: Great protection.
text: I ordered the 'LifeProof FR SERIES Waterproof Case for iPhone 11 Pro - CHALK IT UP (EVERGLADE/CHATEAU GRAY)' for review and would like to share my thoughts. First, I have never owned a LifeProof brand case myself but my daughter had one years ago and it held up for quite a long time before breaking. This new model for the iPhone 11 Pro fits like a glove and seems to have all the protection I would want, however the buttons are a bit stiff. Usually this issue resolves itself with use, but even after a couple of weeks they are still a bit stiff. The case itself is nice looking and not as bulky as I thought it might be which is a bonus. As with all phone cases I love a good balance between bulk and protection. Some are just too bulky with overkill protection but this one balances well for both. Overall I am super happy with this one and think that it's a great value in protecting the iPhone 11 Pro!

title: Best all around case by Otterbox!
text:
I ordered the 'OtterBox SYMMETRY SERIES Case for iPhone 11 Pro - BLACK' for review.
My thoughts on the Symmetry case by Otterbox is that is is absolutely the best all-around case ever. This case has the protection without the bulk. There are other cases out there that are much cheaper that claim the same protection however in my experience it's best to stick with what you know works. I have been a fan of Otterbox for years and they have always performed well and I have never had any issues with fit, protection or quality. No matter what phone you buy this case for, they just work. Buttons work as they should, cut-outs are perfect and protection is amazing. Overall, this case is the best bang for your buck in my honest opinion.

title: Fast charge works great on the S7.
text: I ordered these 'USB Wall Charger, DeepDream 30W Fast Charger Block 2Pack 3-Port USB Charger with QC 3.0, Foldable Plug Adapter for iPhone 11/ Pro/MAX/X/XS/XR/XS Max/8/7/6/Plus, iPad, Samsung and More' for my son who has the S7 and is always borrowing my  charging bricks. Most of what he has had were just the old charging bricks that do not fast charge, so when I gave these to him he was so happy that his S7 will now actually quick charge. The fact that you get two of these is even more of a bonus. He can keep one in his room and one in the gaming room where he spends most of his time anyway lol. Another great thing that I like and appreciate, is that each has 3 ports. This mean you can charge more than just one device at a time. Many of my charging bricks only allow for one device at a time to be charging. So far, my overall opinion of these is that  they are a great value. They feel of good quality and they work great!

title: Remote does not work with DSLR Camera.
text: I ordered this 'Phone Tripod, Fugetek Phone & Camera Tripod with Bluetooth Remote Shutter (51")' for review. First off let me start by saying that I thought this would work with my DSLR camera however upon receiving the Tripod with Bluetooth Remote Shutter, I realized it is only for mobile phones connecting via Bluetooth - at least in my case. My DSLR camera does not have WiFi nor Bluetooth capabilities so I can not test if it would work on cameras that have those options. With that said, the remote does work great for my Android phone. There was no issues with it connecting at all and I will definitely be using it for taking pictures with my phone. The Tripod itself is very lightweight and fairly compact and will support my heavier DSLR camera, but I am not sure I would trust it for long exposures in any kind of breeze. Overall I do like this kit for what it is, and think it has useful value.

title: Basic Stylus
text: I ordered this Digiroot Stylus for iPad, Magnetic Disc Stylus Pen 2019 Updated Touch Capacitive Screen Pens for Apple/iPhone/Ipad pro/Mini/Air/Android/Microsoft/Surface with 3 Replacement Tips - (White) for review along with for use with my Surface Pro 7.  The look of the pen is sleek, the white is nice and bright.  The tips are easy to install and the ability to keep a spare tip in the top of the pen is a bonus. The set comes with three tips.  The cap magnetically attaches to cover the tip or to be placed at the top of the pen so that you do not lose it.  It does have a clear round disc on the tip which I find more bothersome than useful.  I have used it to screen write and note applications and it does write without skipping.  Maybe it was me, but the lines seemed to be a bit shakier looking than when using my original Surface pen.  It does slide well across the page and only requires a light touch.  This is merely a stylus without the function to use it as a mouse.  It does not have any power source, nor does it have Bluetooth ability.  For the price, this is not a bad stylus.  It looks great and feels nice in the hand.  It is just a little too simple for what I need a Surface pen to do.

title: Very sleek looking Surface pen, great value
text:
I ordered this Helyo Surface Pen for review and would like to share my thoughts. My wife wanted to try it with her Surface Pro 7. When it arrived, I realized that it did not list the Pro7 as one of the compatible devices. However, I thought let's try it. It worked perfectly. It powers on quickly. And just the fact that it is rechargeable versus requiring a battery makes it worth the price. My wife would get so frustrated when a pen would stop working due to battery life. It is cheaper than Microsoft branded pens. She has been using the pen for about a week and has yet to recharge it.
It has a very sleek black finish, which is very smooth. It feels very well made and durable. It also has a clip on the top as does a regular pen, to clip it to a notebook or in a pen holder for the Surface. The toggle button is for your right mouse click and to screen write. My wife had no issues with getting it to work with her Surface. She used it as her mouse to see if it would do the trick and it did. She also used it to write in One Note, again no issues.
The pen comes with it's charging cord along with three replacement tips. Overall, this is a great alternative to a branded Surface pen and less expensive. My wife would order another if hers got lost.

title: It's not real leather.
text:
I ordered this 'PULOKA Mens Wallet Leather Phone Pouch Sleeve for iPhone 11 Pro (5.8) iPhone X/Xs Magnetic Snap Top Closure Card Holder Money Clip [Brown]' for review and would like to share my thoughts.
First of all it's not real leather which isn't necessarily a bad thing however I was expecting it to be, because of the main description. I am not sure how it would fit the iPhone 11 Pro but I can say that it will not fit the Note 8. I ended up giving this case to my daughter who has a much smaller Android phone and as you can see in the pictures, it fits quite well. Overall my thoughts are that this case is well constructed and is a good value if this is the type of case you are looking for but it's just not really what I expected and I personally won't use it.

title: It's Bulky but provides Superior protection!
text: I ordered the 'OtterBox DEFENDER SERIES SCREENLESS EDITION Case for iPhone 11 Pro - BLACK' for review. I have reviewed other cases and though I mostly lean towards the Otterbox brand, this Defender case is not my favorite and let me explain why in two words. It's BULKY. With that said I do have to say that this case is a beast for protection and it does do what it is intended to do which is "Protect" your iPhone 11 Pro. It does this very well! Personally I  prefer balance between protection and sleekness. This Defender has zero sleekness haha. Overall, if you are looking for the BEST protection for your iPhone 11 Pro investment, then THIS is the case for you. The quality is there, the cut-outs, buttons and functionality are all superior to most cases on the current market. They have been doing this for a long time and know the business and they know how to make quality products.

title: Best "Wallet" case I have ever had!
text:
I ordered the OtterBox STRADA SERIES Case for iPhone 11 Pro - SHADOW (BLACK/PEWTER)' for review. First and foremost I would like to say that Otterbox is pretty much my go-to when looking for cases for my devices. I don't think I have had a bad one yet. Now with that said and after a bit of time with this Strada version I would like to share my thoughts.

Overall the Strada is a great case. It looks and feels premium. Good grip in hand due to being made of leather. It's got amazing drop protection as you would expect from Otterbox. Now being a wallet case I thought I might hate it, but I definitely don't hate this one. The wallet flap latches with a magnet that is fairly secure, much easier to open than an actual latch. The best part is, when you fold the wallet part behind the phone, the magnet sticks and holds it in place. This solves the top main issue with wallet cases, such that the wallet section is always in the way, and you have to use two hands to hold both halves of the case. This one allows you to use the phone one-handed just like normal with minimal bulk. The wallet cover also has a cut out on the top that allows you to still talk on the phone without having the wallet open. Cards slide in and out. It holds two cards comfortably, probably could add more if needed. The only three things I didn't like about the case, 1 the wallet flap where it magnetizes has a part that sticks out, which makes it more convenient to open, but looks funny and just sticks out. 2 when the wallet is shut, it covers the silence switch on the iPhone. This means I have to fully open it to flip it to silent, or turn sound on. 3 the volume buttons on the case are difficult to find. They aren't clearly defined like the power button, and it takes a minute to feel out which volume button you are pushing or you have to stop and actually look at the case. Outside of that, this is the best wallet case I've ever had. I would recommend to anyone wanting a wallet case (especially if you travel), quality built right to last a long time and not fall apart. Also very much worth mentioning is that the wireless charging works great, and all of the cut-outs are on point!

title: Very happy with this one!
text: I ordered this 'Belkin USB-C Wall Charger 18W w/ 4ft USB-C to Lightning Cable (iPhone Fast Charger for iPhone 11, 11 Pro, 11 Pro Max, XS, XS Max, XR, X, 8, 8 Plus) iPhone Charger, iPhone Wall Charger' for my daughter to use with her iPhone 7. title: Not the most reliable when using a case.
text: I originally ordered the 'AmazonBasics 10W Qi Certified Fast Charging Wireless Stand - White' for my wife who has been having issues charging her mobile phone via the charging cable, yet is charges fine wirelessly with my "brand name" wireless charger. This one works, however with the thin case that she uses, it's a bit finicky to keep the charge going. When you initially set the phone on the charger it starts to charge just fine yet after a little bit the lights start to flash and it looses connection then starts to charge just fine. This will go throughout the night and some nights it gets a full charge and other nights it doesn't. It gets very annoying. With the case off, it works just fine and there is no problem getting a full charge overnight. This seems to be the problem with both my phone, and my wife's, which are of the Android variety. However, my daughter has an iPhone and it seems to function just fine with her phone and case so she has adopted this charger and seems to enjoy it very much. Overall I see value in the Amazon Basics charger for iPhone's, but it not as reliable for the two Android phones we initially ordered it for unfortunately.

title: Screen protector was cracked out of package.

However this particular screen protector was damaged right out of the package but because my wife's phone was without a protector I installed this one anyway. The install was fairly easy but as most designed for the new curved screens, it doesn't fit perfectly. Granted, it's better than no protection and this design really isn't much different than most protectors on the market. For the price this Belkin is a good value but I wish that it hadn't been broken right from the packaging.

title: Wide angle is soft around the edges.
text:
I ordered the Cell Phone Camera Lens, Oroncho Pro 0.5X Ultra Wide Angle Lens and 15X Macro Lens with LED Light and Travel Case,Clip on Phone Lens Kits Compatible with iPhone,Samsung, Pixel,Most Smart Phone' and I have to say I was surprised at how heavy and big this thing is. It's not your average clip on cell phone lens kit for sure. The Lens is designed much like that of a quality DSLR camera lens that screws on to the clip that attaches to your mobile device. The kit essentially is one big lens that is your wide angle, which unscrews in half revealing the macro lens. When screwed together the lens has covers for both ends and stores away nicely in a little pouch, which then can be stored in the zip up pouch. You also get a very small lens cleaning cloth, very short micro USB cable, macro clip-on LED light with adjustable brightness and a small clip that clips to the Zip pouch.

After my initial inspection of the kit I had high expectations and although using the Macro lens does get much closer and better macro images that without, the wide angle lens did not impress as much. As you can see in the attached image of my red vehicle, the lens is very soft around the edges. Image quality is great but the softness around those edges ruins it for me.

Another disappointment was that I can't use the micro USB cable to power the macro LED light because my phone uses the USB type C plug. I love the idea of the macro LED but I don't think it would really work anyway because it does not attach to the lens, but to the side of your phone, which I don't feel that it would really project the light where you would actually need it when taking very close macro shots. I may be wrong but as I said, I can't use it anyway.

Now with all this said, I do think that this lens kit is a great value for the money and it will actually be fun to use for certain situations. My phone actually has a pretty nice wide angle lens built right in so I probably won't use this one as much as the macro.

title: A little bulky but gets the job done.

title: Much better than most cases out there
text: We are partial to Otterbox and iFace cases, but when I saw this one, I liked the perforated holes that allow for the phone to cool, so I thought I would give it a try. First, let me say that it is a solid case and I did feel it would protect my phone fairly well. Is it an Otterbox? NO. Is it an iFace with the rubber, shock-absorbing edges? NO. However, it's still a solid case an you can tell it is like the Kate Spade ones where they are for fashion with zero protection. I would say this one provides an average amount of protection. Since screens are so easy to crack, I usually like my cases to come a little bit higher than the screen so it gives it a bit more protection if it lands flat. If coupled with a glass screen cover, you can't get better protection and I have never had a broken phone between using the two. This case doesn't give too much of an additional lip beyond the glass screen, only a slight lift. But, it's still better than a lot of cases I have seen. title: Great Replacement for Broken Back
text:
The glass on the back of my Galaxy S7 had a big crack in it. I saw this and replaced it on my phone. This is the first time ever replacing something on a smartphone before. This product fitted my Galaxy S7 perfectly and came with the camera lens and sensor protectors on the back of the phone. It already had the adhesive strips attached to the cover for easy attaching to the phone.

I utilized the following tools to complete this replacement:
- Hot air gun (blow dryer will work as well) Too much heat can ruin the battery behind the cover when taking the back off
-Utility knife that came with the replacement cover

I simply applied some hot air to the back of the phone for a few seconds and used the knife supplied to remove the cover. Where there were cracks in the cover, i had to remove/scrape the cover off due to glass shards. After the cover was removed, there was a lot of leftover glue attached to the phone still. I used the knife supplied to scrape the glue off. Where it was difficult to scrape the glue off, i applied a little heat.

After the glue was removed from the phone, i peeled away all the blue strips from the new cover and applied the cover to my phone. I did not run into any issues with positioning or applying the cover. Once the cover was applied, i put some heat on the back of the phone and compressed the phone with my hands for about 30 seconds.
Note: i did this while the phone was off so the glue could harden.

I then let the phone sit for about 20 minutes to get to room temperature before i turned it on. I do notice a small hair line between the phone cover and the phone itself.

Rather than spending over $1000 to get a new phone, this $30 replacement cover worked for me. The phone does resist water, but if water brushed up against the sides of the phone or rain was dropping on the phone for awhile, I would put the phone in a bag of rice still. Anything that is replaced other than by the manufacture can fail from things like water resistance, which is why i did not rate this product on water resistance.

title: Better than standing wireless charger

title: Nice band if you don't mind taking out the Fit2 to charge.
text:
UPDATE: It's been a couple of months now since I purchased this. The band loosened up and it's easy to pop it in and out now. No rips. It's really a great band. I still wish I could charge it while in the band.

Out of the package, the product seems rugged and less feminine than the stock band. Kinda a pain getting the watch to seat properly in the band. Thought I was gonna rip it. Other then that, the first day went great.

Then I went to charge it. It doesn't charge when on the charger. You have to remove it from the band every time. Because the band wraps around the watch the gap it creates is larger than the prongs on the base can't make contact.

Silicone is flexible but if I'm having to remove it daily to charge (and it's a snug fit) it will not hold up very long.

That being said, I will continue to use in the meantime. Customer service has been great. Very responsive to my questions. I will update again if/when the band fails.

title: Great Ring! Really Sticks!
text:
I love this phone ring/kickstand! Let me first say I was a bit skeptical about it staying on on my case however, I always have extra tapes. Or a trick or 2 up my sleeve to get it to stick. Haha! That said, I was wrong up to this point it is really on there! All you do is peel the ring from the packaging and stick it to your phone case ( i cleaned my case with an alcohol wipe prior due to it being a glossy case). After sticking the ring onto my case I put pressure and held it for 30 seconds on each end. I did this before bed. I've had no issues. I have a Samsung galaxy 9 plus with a pretty good size case and its holding up. None of the crystals have fallen out. It swivels 360 degrees smoothly. It doesn't hurt my fingers and works great as a kick stand. I love the base the ring is attached too. It's black with a slight shimmer and a bit of texture. It appears to be of good quality. I've had it about 2 weeks or so. Again, up to this moment I'm very happy with the product. I feel the product is priced adequately and I would definitely recommend this to family and friends.
In my opinion, I find this Item to be what's described by the seller.
I purchased this on my own. I was Not paid to give this review. I like to leave reviews to help others.
Thanks for reading.

title: Works as Described!
text:
Absolutely love this product! I have the proper fitting one. I removed the one that was too small. Extremely easy. I use an electronic stylus; this shield does not interfere with the effectiveness. My screen is much more clear and finger prints and other debris are repelled when using the armorsuit shield.
I highly recommend this product.
Definitely read directions and watch video prior to installation makes for a perfect installation. Remember to register for lifetime warranty!

title: It's truly a great product! Make sure sizing is accurate
text:
Love this product! Easy to install.
Too bad they sent me the wrong size for my phone. The worst part was I did't realize it until I was installing it on my Galaxy 9 PLUS! I realized it was too short and didn't curve around the edges because they sent me one for a Galaxy 9! Bummer, I did such a good job putting it on! TV hats why I decided what the heck let's see how well it works before I order the correct one. Besides I can practice with the removal process.
So far it stands up to it's name! Between my nails and my electronic stylus it's looking good. Upon installation I nicked it with my nail nothing major. It's kind of worked itself out now that it's dry.
That said, I'm not sure about taking a key to the screen or anything drastic like that! Lol
I stated I use an electronic stylus, the protector shield hasn't changed the efficiency of my stylus at all. It has helped keep smudges and debris from my screen hence a clearer image.
I recommend first reading all the instructions, watch the suggested video and matching the shield to your phone prior to installation.
Don't want to be out 18$ for no need!
I'd recommend getting this armorsuit shield. I will get the proper fitting shield for my phone I do like it.
Thanks for reading my review I trust it's been helpful.

text: What a great idea. This stand is a convenient and attractive charging station that can be kept out on your desk so your apple pencil is always fully charged and at the ready.

text: Nice charging station. A simple ledge hold a phone in place so bumping it can knock the phone off - you need to keep that in mind when placing it (I like to keep it on a nightstand where my phone can charge and still serve as an alarm clock, etc). An additional feature that I like is that I can sit my airport on the base (behind the phone) and keep them charged too. The whole thing folds flat for storing. Works great.

title: Great night stand phone holder
text: I mounted this on my bedside table facing my bed. It charges it while I sleep while providing a night clock with an alarm. Lay the phone within its jaws and it gently closes to hold the phone firmly in place. A button on either side opens the jaws to release the phone. Very handy.

title: Convenient recharging without fumbling with wires
text: Convenient recharging for my Samsung buds. I've strategically positioned this along with a wireless phone charger near where I'm most likely to use the buds. No fumbling with cables, simply place the buds case on the charger and they're always ready to go.

title: Multiple ports along with wireless charging station on top
text: It seems logical to keep one of these on your desk. In addition to multiple USB ports for multiport charging, it also has a wireless charger on its top, allowing you to just lay your phone down on it to recharge while you're sitting there using the computer. It even has an output indicator on its display to show how much power its putting out.

title: Small convenient backup charging source for your phone
text: Handy little item, not much bigger than a lipstick or a Bic lighter. It charges with a standard USB charger, then serves as a flashlight, or you can use it as a charging source. I let my phone run down to 84%. Plugged the phone into this unit for an hour and checked again - the phone was up to 96%. Great to have around for power outages or travel, etc.

title: unbelievably easy - like replacing a battery in a remote
text: Unbelievably easy! Its like replacing batteries in a remote (maybe even easier). You slide the cover off, slide the hard drive in (the connectors align perfectly), then slide the cover back on. Its ready to use! It is all plastic, so its very lightweight... and probably not as sturdy as a metal one would be, but so far, no peoblems. It gets the job done with minimal fuss.

title: Sturdy - perfect fit
text: This is an excellent phone case. I wanted something simple but effective to protect my S20+ and this is it. It's a mat black finish and has shock absorbing recesses inside the edges. The bezel stands proud of the screen as well as the camera block - so anything short of a direct hit and they should be protected as well. The size does not appreciably alter the size of the phone - it's minimal, you'll now it's there, but it's not anything that's cumbersome. The side buttons align perfectly and give positive response in use. If you've used the S20+ without a case. you know the glossy surface makes it a slippery little beast. This "soft" finish isn't exactly a "gel" but it is soft enough to make it easy tp hold onto. Nice case!

title: Nice selfie stick with functional features
text: This is a surprisingly useful selfie stick. Your cell phone is held in place by a (typical) spring loaded clamp and is, if course, adjustable for angle and orientation. But the handle also has some fold down legs to form a tripod. While I assumed this might be a little flimsy, there's a slide lever on the base that holds these legs in position. Not quit as sturdy as a real tripod, but for a temporary solution, it works very well. Theres a blue tooth trigger for snapping the shot from the handle end, a d it slides out to form a remote control for those times when you're using the tripod. This is a decent selfie stick.

title: Well made multi port charger
text: This 6 port charging station covers all the bases. It includes ports for all sorts of devices. Unfortunately, it specifies the ports intended use in terms like "type c". Without any further instructions, that leaves a few questions in my mind (I suppose if my devices used "type c", I would already know about it?) Anyway, the unit is small and unobtrusive. It seems to be very well made and I currently have several devices plugged into the lower ports and everything is working as it should.

title: Works well - nice solid feel.
text:
Seems well made. The main barrel has a ball point pen in one end (which writes smoothly) and the fine point touch screen stylus on the other (the one with the clear disc shaped thing on it). Then each end has a cap that screws on and adds a "finger-like" end. One of these ends is rubber and the other a fiber mesh. They're both soft and in use I couldn't tell much difference on my phone or my touch screen laptop, but their may be a difference on other devices, I suppose. The caps have threads to allow caps to be screwed onto each other, so you can configure it however you choose.

The fine point stylus with the clear disc cover is intended for those times when you want pin point accuracy or for signing/drawing and the clear disc let's you do it without dragging a pointy object across your screen. It seems to work well.

It is made of metal (other that the tips, of course) and has a nice solid feel to it. It also comes with a small leather pouch to keep it in. Inside the package there's replacements for all 4 tips. If you want to get away from using your finger for touchscreens, this is definitely a viable solution.

title: Well made cable -
text: Nice 10 foot charging cable. My biggest concern with charging cables like this is durability. The end that plugs into the device thats being charged is usually subjected to a certain amount of rough treatment. This particular cable has a strong braided cable that's attached to a molded connector. Only time will tell, but this appears to be a well made cable/connector system an I expect this cable to hold up well over time.

title: Every kind of small tool imaginable.
text:
I didnt realize there were so many different types of screw heads out there. But I have to say, with as many different shapes and sizes presented in this set, I'm sure itll have something that'll get the job done.

The quality of the tools is okay... I dont think you'd want this kit in am industrial setting, but for the occasional odd job, it should be okay. Bear in mind the price...

Probably the biggest selling point to me is that it has pretty much everything you'd ever need for any kind of small item repair, and it has them all organized in a handy little box. It even has a little magnetiser/demagnetizer tool, too.

This only for small item repair... watch, cell phone, glasses... that sort of thing.

title: Easy replacement pendant...
text: Bought the freedom alert system a couple years ago for a relative and it has worked flawlessly... in fact, I would say it's literally been a lifesaver. Then recently, we started getting error messages from the base unit saying there was no connection to the pendant, so we bought this replacement. It synced itself up easily and we were back in business.  We never did figure out what caused the original pendant to fail, but after several years of somewhat rough treatment, we were just glad to be able to get a replacement and get it working again. Also thankful that the base unit notified us of the problem instead of having to find out when we needed it to work!

What is very nice, and isn't really shown in the pictures, is that the holder breaks down into 2 pieces that fit into each other like a puzzle and it can be stored flat in a handy zippered pouch which comes included. VERY good for traveling in that way. But the stand just doesn't have enough heft to it to actually USE the phone while its on the stand.

If you had a smaller phone it might work better but overall this stand is a better idea than it is a reality.

text: Item arrived broken. The outer package was fine but the ring stand was loose in the plastic box inside and when I opened it it was broken. Very disappointed. I tried to pop it back in hoping I'd be able to use it but it's useless. I don't even want to return this because it's a complete hassle and ultimately not really worth it.

title: Works very well
text: I really like this stand.  It's heavy enough not to fall over even if bumped.  It is small enough that it doesn't take up much room.  I like the adjustments available for angling the phone just right.  The color, rose gold, is a little more rose than gold.  I like that too!

title: These may save your phone screen, but need replacing.
text: These screen protectors have helped twice when I've dropped my phone, but the protectors (rather than the phone) cracked both times.  The seller has been great about replacing them, however, since they are under warranty for 24 months.

title: Strong Recommendation
text: Exactly what was needed! The problem with this phone is that it looks stylish but is unbearably slippery. This case solves that problem totally. Good grip, tactile feel...good cushioning in a thin shell. Nifty cutout for the stylus. Also cutout for charge port. Hadn't snagged on clothing yet either.  Maybe I'm imagining enhanced Bluetooth and wifi but surely no worse. Strongly recommended.

title: I can't hold onto these as everybody wants one.
text:
The single most convenient item for the traveler in NorthAm these days.
Don't buy one get three, everyone who sees them will buy one from you.

title: I have owned several of these different brands of iPhone ...
text:
I have owned several of these different brands of iPhone cases with cardholders, none have impressed me.
Until now. This one is perfection, very high quality and just feels right. Bravo!

title: Be Aware
text:
I really wanted this to work...it didn't. The neat blue LED fired up fine, but no chargee phonee, regardless of what i did.
So i broke out the multimeter and tested the terminals....no power there. I sent a note to vendor asking them to replace with a tested and functional replacement. They have refunded me money, which is nice but speaks volumes about a bad product IMHO

title: Please please do not waste your money
text: If i could give it 0 stars i would. Just about the least impressive collection of pieces parts that don't quite fit together to make anything worthwhile I have ever (sadly) come across. Please please do not waste your money.  very unhappy indeed.

text: I lived it, well made but Mom hated the pineapples

title: It's a stretch
text: Loved everything buts it's hard to stretch on the phone

title: Just what I was looking for
text: Good phone ring holder stand  with mirror

title: Highly recommend
text: I tread my own silk string though it tug inside  my blouse when going places , so not too showy  pull out when need to use ,

title: Now that's more like it.  Protective yet slim and lightweight.
text:
This case is legit. It protects the Kindle all around including at the corners. It adds little bulk but protects the screen well, with a soft micro-fiber finish inside the screen cover. Its "origami" stand-up feature is like others of the type (meaning, it takes a little practice to fold it correctly) but is comfortable to hold and use. The material is a nice vinyl with a firm plastic body into which the Kindle easily snaps. It won't get dingy and gross over time and will be super-easy to clean.

Importantly, if you want the stand-up feature in a case, the origami style is naturally less bulky than the kind that folds from the bottom, like the Finite Multi-Angle Flip Case I originally tried (and immediately returned after finding it didn't protect the Kindle's corners and was thick as a pillow).

This case's magnetic auto-on/off function works fine with my 3rd-Generation (2019 release, purchased Fall 2022) Oasis. Its charging port and power button are easily accessible. The cover integrates a recess for the page-up/down buttons-- thoughtful.

This case has the Oasis-style stepped shape to its back, so it's easy to hold. I see a few reviews here complaining that the cover doesn't magnetically latch open, but I've had three origami cases for my various Kindles and have never had one that did. They did have a magnetic latch for keeping the origami folded when using it as a stand, and this one does too. Bottom line: this a nicely executed example of the origami-case theme.

Maybe best of all: this case (at least mine, in black) looks REALLY nice. It's worthy of the elegant Oasis. It puts the "Yum" in premium.

I'm very happy. Recommended.

title: Plug and play, verified compatible with my late-2018 MacBook Pro i9
text:
My MacBook Pro was the hairy-chested beast of mid/late 2018. Its processor and GPU drink power when utilization is high, and my heavy use of virtual machines is a practical stress-test in itself.

This power brick works nicely and, as you can see in the attached photo, its C1 port delivers all the necessary juice to make my machine happy. (You'll need a USB-C cable capable of delivering 100W, of course.)

Unlike some other posters, I like that there are no LEDs to indicate that it's plugged in. I have some adaptors with LEDs so bright you can tan by them. This will not light up the room, and your devices will tell you if they're charging or not.

So far, so good. "It just works."

title: Not bad.  Not great, but not bad.
text:
I'm happy with this band, which I got "used" for a great price from Amazon (not really used, just the box had been opened; the plastic protective film on the band hadn't been removed).

It comes with a nice tool for pushing the pins out to adjust the length. Pushing them back in is left as an exercise for the user but is not difficult-- I used the flat side of a butter knife.

The band has a nice brushed-stainless finish and feels substantial but not bulky or heavy. I had no trouble finding a link arrangement that fit my wrist nicely. It took me perhaps 15 minutes from unwrapping to wearing. It looks great, and the clasp arrangement is first-rate and very easy to use.

As to style, most link bands including the pricey Apple ones all have links that are all the same width. A few, such as the reasonably-priced iiteeology, have a "gradient" width that flares where it meets the Watch. That detail gives a very premium look. I wish this band had it, but for what I paid there can be no complaints.

The lugs that slide into the Watch are just ever so slightly not the right shape. They stick out from their slots in my Series 5 by a hair's width. Docking a star for that.

title: Really nice case / Holding up well nearly six months in
text:
Update, six months in:

This is a fantastic case! When I bought it (see original review below) I was a little skeptical of the price. But it is holding up beautifully and is, so far, the best built case I've had since my original iPhone in 2007.

In my original review, considering the price, I said I'd prefer the Eloven case, of which I've had several. No more! I'd rather have this and not have it look like it was chewed-on by squirrels after a few weeks, which was a problem with the Eloven. This looks brand-new still.

And the slide cover for the cards makes the niftiest snick-snick sound when you open and close it. You know how the elevator doors sounded on the original Star Trek series? Exactly like that!

Recommended. Look no further.

====

Original review:

Until the whole world supports Apple Pay, I need to carry a minimum of 5 cards (driver's license, ATM, insurance, personal credit card, business credit card). So a wallet-case has been part of my daily carry for years. The Eloven cases have been great but they don't yet offer a version for my new iPhone 12 Pro, though it's been out for months now. So I got this case, despite its price.

It's nice. I got the Sandstone finish, which is grippy and attractive. The buttons are well executed and the phone is really well protected. I see an anonymous review here that contends the phone's screen is flush with the front of the case, but that is not true: it's safely indented so you can place the phone face-down on a table without scratching the screen. The phone's corners are well protected. I'm able to fit five cards in it (two less than the Eloven, but sufficient). The card cover opens with a satisfying snick-snick. I could do without the silly molded "bolt hardware" on the back but otherwise I like the looks, and the matte sandstone finish is pleasing in the hand and unique to look at.

It is a little hard to justify the price, but at the moment there's not much competition for someone who wants more than a couple cards in this kind of back-bustle format. There are some with front flaps the cover the screen and carry the cards, but the cards scratch the screen with those.

I'd prefer an Eloven case but, lacking such a choice, this is a good solution.

title: Good looking, holds lots of cards, sturdy
text: This is a nice case that protects your iPhone well and holds more cards than most-- I have five (driver's license, insurance card, ATM card, business and personal credit cards).  I will be getting my iPhone 11 Pro in a few weeks and bought this ahead of time.  It arrived quickly, and since my year-old iPhone XS's case is fraying, I wondered if that phone would fit into this case.  And: it does!  The square cutout for the 11 Pro's fancy camera arrangement is larger than needed for the old phone's simpler camera bump, but it works well.  When my new phone is in my possession, I'll just swap it out.  Happy camper here.

title: What a nice case
text:
UPDATE: I now have my iPhone X (and what a wonder it is-- feels like alien tech!) and can fill in a few blanks.

The case fits beautifully! And five credit cards do fit inside without issue! The cards sit deep in the body of the case, and there is little danger that they will come out unless you pull them out even if the door is open. A TSA agent complimented me on this case the first day I had my phone in it.

The case feels good in the hand and grips nicely. It seems likely to protect the phone well, with its combination of hard shell and elastomeric rim and corners. It is handsome and makes my X look good.

I'm happy.

A hint for the manufacturer: Put a halfway-open detent in the door's hinge mechanism. This will let it be used as a stand for watching landscape-format videos! As it is, it almost works, but a little vibration will make the door snap either fully open or fully closed.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

I don't have my iPhone X quite yet but the Lumion people delivered really quickly, and the case is really nice. I got the Blue Sea version, and the color is gorgeous, rich and muted. The case seems constructed well and looks very protective. It should complement my silver X very nicely.

All you folks considering how to protect your lovely new phone really should give this case a good look.

Prior to this I've had only wallet (folio) cases for the decade I've rocked iPhones, for a bunch of reasons:

1) It's nice not to have to carry a separate wallet... one less thing to forget or lose.

2) Conventional, non-folding cases with slots for a couple of cards have been available and are less bulky than folio cases, but previous versions of iOS will display your alerts on the lock screen, which is a privacy issue. I do like having my alerts on the lock screen but don't want everyone else to see them, so for me the answer 'til now has been a folding case that covers the screen, even though it's bulkier.

3) Now, with the iPhone X, you can set things so alerts only appear when you, the owner, are looking at the screen! So the privacy concern no longer applies.

4) Nor does a folding folio really provide all that much more protection to the screen, since they tend to flop open if you drop the phone, unless there's a snap to secure them closed. But a snap adds annoyance when you want to get to the phone one-handed... and, snap or not, holding the flap open while you talk on or use the phone can be annoying.

My solution is this case. It carries "up to" five cards and a bit of cash in a securely latching compartment, which is brilliant. It provides corner and edge protection. Notification privacy is no longer an issue, and the whole assembly is smaller in my pocket than any folio case could be. And the price is good, especially considering the apparent quality of the case and its likely longevity. Decent leather folio cases constructed of durable materials are pushing and even exceeding $100 now!

I'll update this once my phone arrives in a few weeks, but so far I'm impressed.

title: An excellent example of the breed
text: Essential for travel.  Nicely constructed.  The USB outlets are especially appreciated.

title: High power, high quality, worldwide compatible, and NO BULKY POWER BRICK (worth shouting about!)
text:
Nearly Five (!) Year Update: This continues to be my constant companion in my incessant travels, typically >400,000 air km/year. It Just Works, everywhere.

Two year Update: I've been traveling internationally nonstop with this 10-port charger and a little snake-pit of cables. I've charged up to eight devices at a time, including current hogs like my iPad and iPhone X. Never a problem! No buzzing audio corruption as can happen with poorly constructed chargers, either. Its single-cord power input with an internal, worldwide-compatible power supply Just Works. It's a tidy, lightweight, reliable solution for folks with a lot of gizmos that need charging. Recommended.

ORIGINAL REVIEW FROM 2015:

Perfect for those with lots of devices needing USB power for charging or operation. WOW: NO POWER BRICK/WALL-WART!! ...The two-prong AC cable connects directly to this unit. Neat and tidy! Worldwide-voltage compatible, too, so great for travel (it's very compact).

There's an indicator light to show that AC power is applied, and it does the job without lighting up your room.

Note this is not a USB hub intended for data communication between devices. It's for power, and it provides a lot of it.

My impression is that this is a delightfully high quality device. I'm adding Anker to my list of preferred suppliers!

title: Two Stars
text: I've gone through a couple of these.  They don't hold up.

title: Doesn't hold up, poor quality materials
text:
Good design, lousy materials. Apparently there's not a shred of leather on the thing. After about six months of mostly pocketed use, the "leather" is worn away at the corners, revealing a tacky fabric matrix. The pouch which holds the phone stretches out after just a couple weeks, allowing the phone to slide out and crash to the floor.

I complained about the loose pouch and Marware, to its credit, sent me a new case. But the replacement is wearing even faster than the first, and its pouch loosened up in the same way.

I've been buying Marware's products for a long time and am very disappointed in the quality of this case.

title: Easily shatters
text: It is very smooth and it looks like there's nothing on, until it falls face first and completely shatters. It's my 4th one replacing in a month. The cheaper plastic ones are better than this.

title: Works
text: Wasn't sure if it will fit the phone but it did and all is WELL.

title: NOT what other reviews said!
text: After having to take my phone out of its protective case several times lately to replace SIM cards, the screen protector I had on it cracked in several places. I ordered these due to the good reviews and decent price. Once I received them, I followed the instructions carefully. I cleaned the phone's screen thoroughly, dried it correctly, and made sure there was no dust or debris left on it. I carefully placed the screen protector as instructed. However, the corners will NOT stay down! This looks bad and totally defeats the purpose of having it on my phone! After having it on my phone for less than 4 days, I'm having to replace it. The little hole for the camera lens is a magnate for dust as well. I'm NOT happy with this item at all!

title: Great phone case for my husband
text: I had purchased a similar case a couple years ago for my husband. It needed to be replaced and this case has the same features, look and feel.  My husband is very happy with it. He can protect his phone and carry is essential ID and cards with him easily.

title: Best iPhone Case Ever!
text: I love this phone case.  It is pretty, soft, durable and the features are great.  I love being able to remove my phone from the wallet without having to pry it out of the case. The magnet is strong enough to grip the wallet, yet can be easily removed when you wish it.

title: Works great
text: Got this so I could charge my Apple Watch and my phone at the same time, works perfectly and I have an extra one to keep in my purse/backpack.

title: Cute
text: This band is really cute it's not as masculine looking as the band that comes with the watch but it also isn't overly frilly or decorative. The paint has also stayed on flawlessly so it's pretty durable. The band isn't the most comfortable and sometimes the chain gets caught in my hair, but overall I love this band.

title: Perfect wallet case.
text: This case is protective and durable. The wrist strap is convenient as well, and gives me piece of mind after having my phone stolen. I've bought multiple of this exact case over the years for various phones and it's just what I needed. Not having to fold the wallet portion over the front of the phone is ideal.

title: Looks great
text: This was so much easier to put on than my previous cover and looks much better. I did have to alter some of the settings to get my touch screen to work around the edges, but it all works fine now :)

title: Easy
text: Usually screen protectors are really hard to put on but they make this really easy, I was able to do it no problem. No bubbles or lifted corners either.

title: Simple Solution for face light and product photography
text: I do a lot of portrait photography as a hobby and also interested in macro level photos. This ring light is a great aid in my photos. Even though I have flashes with my camera, I now prefer to use this very convenient ring light. It is USB powered and I can even attach to a power bank to make it more handy.  The ring gives and even distribution of light across the face which give excellent photos. The color temperature adjustment is another benefit. Very satisfied with this cool lighting solution

title: Adorable
text: This product surprised me. It is so cheap comparing air pen and do most of the work. It doesn't need to recharge frequently. Turn on and immediately it is ready to work.  Excellent product. Saved me a lot

title: Works Great For Indoor Projects
text:
This is pretty decent for filming or photographing indoor projects. It's lightweight and folds up compactly, thereby making it easy to store when not in use. The footprint is small even when fully extended, so it's ideal for placing on a countertop or desk to film. It is telescoping so can remain small and compact for up-close shots or stand at a good height for wider shots. It has a really firm grip on the phone, so there is no worries of the phone falling out of the holder.
With that said, it's lightweight quality might be a challenge in an outdoor setting where there is wind or uneven ground. With the phone attached, it is top heavy, but the width of the legs is enough to keep it steady on a flat surface. The legs are not independently adjustable from each other so you cannot adjust them for uneven ground, which is fine because I don't think this is meant for rugged outdoor projects anyway. The material is a hard plastic that is somewhat thin in places. This is best used indoors on flat surfaces. The adjustable head angle is very versatile and the screw nut to adjust it holds tight.
I'm pretty happy with this tripod and use it for filming cooking and craft lessons.

title: Perfect!  Exactly what I was looking for
text: I had to write a review on this band to hopefully provide others looking for the same thing, some hope.  I had previously purchased another band from a different manufacturer that was supposed to be black but when I received it, there were white threads interwoven giving the appearance of a two tone band.  This one is all black like advertised.  An added bonus is the band is a normal width for a men's watch band and has metal end clips rather than cheap plastic.  I am very pleased with the quality, look, and feel.  Well worth the price paid.

title: Awesome watch band at a great price
text: This watch band is absolutely fantastic.  It is very comfortable. My previous Galaxy watch had a metal band which made the watch weigh so much and as my wrist would expand and contract depending on temperature, it was never quite the right fit.  With this watch band I rarely noticed I'm even wearing a watch, it is so comfortable.  I've had no issues with quality of the product.  I would definitely buy it again.

title: Clip and Belt Llops. Versatile.
text: 1-- it fits my protective cover by UaG - similar to an OtterBox.  2-- The tight CLIP for beltless pants or attaching to a purse/bag allows horizontal usage ANDY the 3 BELT LOOPS gives my phone secure horizontal usage. These three belt loops give it more stability than just a single belt loop.  3--  The smooth, Matt finish leather is nice. The "CellBee" logo is embossed into the leather. Subtle and classy.  4-- The ends of the case are partially open so the ringing of the phone and the alarms are not muffled.  5-- it's easy to open up the case from its full length flap where you can just put your fingertips under it and lift open the case quickly to retrieve your phone.  6--  The interior has a smooth fabric finish that makes the cell phone glide easily in or out.  7-- this case fits all my needs. I am so glad that I found this case and at such a reasonable price. I highly recommend it. 8--  This fits my iPhone 6 Plus with the protective cover (like an Otterbox) and still easily slides in and out.

I probably did more research than I needed to for USB C cables but this seemed like the best choice out there for what you pay and I'm very happy with my purchase. I highly recommend them and will buy them again when I need more.

I love the raise the edges but out of protection to keep the edges of my phone from getting cracked, in the event that I drop it. It fits perfectly, and have hold on the side in case you want to attach a lanyard to it.

title: It could be a little better!
text: I like the colors and the glitter. I like the fact that a finger holder came attached. What I didn't like is that it's thick. My phone seems to heat up while it is in the case. Also the little finger holder came off after about 3 weeks. And I don't feel like it gives my phone enough edge protection if you drop it flat on the floor the screen is not really protected.

title: Great alternative to expensive tablet pens
text: I like these so much I purchased a set for my daughter. We both have Samsung A7 tablets. Works great! I use it with my Samsung Galaxy S9+ too. Very accurate! Great value!

title: Versatile and multifunctional
text: I like the light selection and the versatility of this stand. We use it mostly for zoom meetings with an 8.5 in. Tablet. It is mostly easy to assemble. The holder for the tablet to secure it to the pole can be a little tricky to assemble. The bracket that holds the tablet to the pole assembly isn't as secure as I'd like, but overall it works great and it is a great value compared to many others on the market.

title: Holds your phone well.
text: It is just for the phone. Adjustable to different angles. Sturdy. It will NOT hold a tablet nor an e-reader as it wasn't designed for them. I mainly use it for recipes and YouTube instructions. At this price point you have nothing to lose.

title: Works like a charm
text: It sticks well to the windshield and holds the phone just as promised. My one complaint is the way the car charger connects. In my car the cable crosses the radio controls which is no big deal, but it is annoying. Anyway, the mount is fully adjustable and comes with one mystery cable and an adhesive sticker if you wish to do a dash mount.

title: Does the job
text: It's nice, but not as handsome as the one I got at the French Market in Charleston for my other phone.  The leather is not as rich nor as rugged as that one - and I paid considerably more for this!  Also, this one is missing the magnetic snap closure to keep it secure - a feature I will sorely miss!  Regrettably, this style makes picture taking more difficult, but it does keep the screen cleaner, which is the trade off.  This one also keeps the volume buttons easily accessible, which my expensive Otterbox (sold by Verizon mandate!) did not.  Decided I will use this case for everyday and switch out to the Otterbox when I go overseas and primarily want to take pictures.

title: Does what I need, but doesn't stick
text: This is exactly what I was looking for. It allows me to have my phone on the dash, without having to remove the wallet-cover protector. However, the sticky circle on the bottom doesn't stick to my textured, hard plastic dash. (Yes, I removed the plastic film to expose the stickiness. And yes, I cleaned and dried my dashboard before installing it.) My dashboard has a pimply texture (I don't know what else to call it), and the thing just does not stick. I'm considering velcro....

title: Bought two--both duds.
text: I recently bought a new phone, which had two USB-C cables. I usually keep two at home, one in the car and another in the office, so I bought two more of this one. Neither of these two cables worked with the chargers (although both of the cables which came with the phone worked fine). I am going to stop buying USB cables from Amazon. Of the 6 I've bought over the last year, fewer than half have worked. Very disappointed. It's not worth the effort to repackage and take to the post office to return it. If I could give it negative stars, I would.

I tried a couple of times removing and replacing it, but it was not correct.  I tririmmed the top to leave the camera exposed and the thing just looked like crap.  In the end, I threw all of the mess out, except the screen cleaning cloth.  DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT.  Go somewhere that sells Nokia Screen Covers--NOT HERE!

Compared to using no case, this is obviously much more protective.  It also adds bulk and weight, which we don't particularly mind for our use.  We don't really carry it, but use it mostly around the home.  The thing I like the least is the plastic screen protector.  The plastic is sticky compared to much smoother glass.  It also seems to accumulate crud much faster.

text: Never actually got this to work. The coax from the antenna was coming out of the antenna housing (looks like packed to tight in shipping?). Still tried it by hand, went up to roof, etc., no difference at all in signal. And I checked bands to make sure T-Mo uses 2100 here.

title: Case does NOT fit a K8 (2018), cutouts wrong (not all, but most)
