text: Too small diameter, tiny little thing.

title: Sound and volume are great, quality and usability..., not...
text: First thing I did was charge the headset. The tried to use it, went downhill from there. Luckily, you get two ear bows, one broke trying to put the thing on. The other one cuts into my ear lobe after ten minutes, more due to the heavy weight of the thing than the thin, cheap plastic bow. Overall, sound is loud enough to hear in a car with windows down, bluetooth goes in and out, but overall, stays connected most of the time and has good sound. But I couldn't wear for more than 1/2 hour at a time. The thing is really heavy for a bluetooth. Like, really heavy. It wears you out from the ear bow/holder cutting into your lobe. Wanted to like this, esp. at the price, but need something different.

title: Knockoff headset, had an older H730, this is not the same in too many ways
text: As other reviewers allege, I'll make my own guess that these are now all knockoffs, or ones that didn't pass QC and someone yanked from the rubbish tin, to resell as the original item. There's too much about the latest one I ordered (Aug 2019) to say it's not a Motorola though. Different menu, sounds different, buttons don't work the same. Mine was in a perpetual half-mute condition, the other side could barely hear me unless I shouted with my hand cupping my mouth towards the earpiece. Total piece of garbage. Too bad, I really, really liked my old H730.

title: Small and light, but volume at highest is too low to use in car
text: This is light and appears made well, would be perfect, but even with BT at highest level, I can't hear people on the other end of the line while in a vehicle. Cannot project over background noise. This has no volume control itself, it relies solely on the volume level of the phone's bluetooth connection.

title: Just as advertised. Battery won't charge for some reason, but kit was good
text: Came just as advertised and battery had about 50% charge, so I was able to recover data from phone, but for some reason, it won't charge? Could be a battery issue, or could be charging port. Phone shows charger on and "charging" but it doesn't actually charge. Left overnight, it lost some percent of power, not the other way around. Anyway, kit seems excellent, especially for the price. No regrets.

title: Fits and works (if you take your time to clean and install properly)
text: I still like these kinds of protectors more than the stupid, breakable glass things. These fit properly and work very well. Never had a broken or scratched screen with these (unlike my experiences with the glass ones!)

title: Loved the plastic shields they made, these glass ones break more often than Chinese tools!
text: First one of these was broken in a week. Screen was fine. Second one is now cracked (after three-weeks). Screen is fine. The plastic protectors always worked well and to date, I have not broken a screen with one of them on, so the notion that the glass ones protect better is utter rubbish!

title: This actually works!
text: Place phone in this fairly large clutch (not something a dude normally carries, but...) and no signal. Someone can call you and get VM. Pull out, and phone connects again. Same thing with wifi/data. Nothing while it's in this folder. Def works.

title: Good protection, sturdier than TPU cases, but thin enough it fits in pockets
text: Was worried this would be too thick of a case, but turns out it's not. It's good protection and a little stiffer than the standard TPU cases, but it isn't "rubbery" rubber that sticks to everything, so it goes in and out of pockets easily. All the holes line up too (many of the TPU cases are mis-aligned).

title: These peel off easily, too easily
text: These "peel off" after a few weeks. Don't like the glass one, they do break easily, but these ones have the long cut out for the camera and speaker and it gets pulled away. Look for some other brand.

title: Hold up well, easy to put on without bubbles, but don't entirely cover screen.
text: Don't entirely cover the screen, but work acceptably. Work better than the glass ones that are hard as hell to install and crack easily. These hold up well.

title: Perfect fit and cut outs for Moto E4 (NOT for E4 Plus), but color is way off
text:
First the good: This case IS for a Moto E4 (it's NOT for a Moto E4 Plus), so all the cut outs match perfectly for my Moto E4 (NOT Plus). It's nice that it actually has cut outs for the volume and power as the cases that have molded-in sections over the power and volume don't work half the time and you find yourself having to press multiple times to get it to finally press the phone button.

The bad: The photo shows a pic that looks like a solid color, cream purple, but it's not. It's an opaque, see-thru with purple "tint" to it. I like the "pudding" cases that are solid color as the color doesn't "disappear" when you install the case on a black phone (you know, the color most people get?). So on my phone, you can't tell it's purple, just looks like a black phone. So the pics are very deceptive. If you don't care about seeing it (I wanted it to be more visible and personal, so I could tell my phone from others), then this is a super deal on a protective case that works well.

title: Hard and thick, NOT "ultra-thin"
text: Ad says "ultra-thin," but I have no idea to what they are comparing that to as the case is hard and very thick. Won't fit in pocket with this case on. The other TPU (cheapo) cases fit fine. This is NOT thin at all compared to most cases. Hard and thick.

title: They are just spacers, but work perfectly for the job (AA into C-size batt item)
text: These are just empty plastic containers with spacers so an AA battery can be used in place of C-size batts. With that said, they work perfectly as-claimed and I'm using them in garage flashlights with rechargeables.

title: Did not fit my body properly, but looked well-made.
text: Didn't fit properly and looks like it would snag on stuff.

title: Works OK, only covers center of screen where it's flat
text: OK, doesn't cover the whole screen, but the screen has a radius on each side which would make it hard to cover.

title: Not the best, try another brand
text: Not the best. I've installed many protectors on phones over the years, going through two or three different smart phones each year (testing, custom ROM's, etc.), these just don't cut it. They grab specs like crazy, even in a filtered, clean room. Have to use tape to clean the sticky side of the protector AND the screen, after alcohol cleaning of the screen. Still air bubbles and protector is too thick to force the bubbles out, you have to re-apply many times to get it "almost" right. Sheesh...

title: Good case, but too thick where headset inserts, holding plug out from phone.
text: Like this cover for the matte finish on the back (so it's not so slippery and doesn't CAUSE drops that it's meant to protect from.., like other TPR and hard plastic covers I've used). Don't like that it doesn't quite fit as snug as other brands I've used in the past and the hole for the 3mm headset isn't large enough or flat enough, ie; it holds a plug out from the phone enough to cause an intermittent connection issue that goes away if you hold it in manually with a lot of pressure. Let go, and you get mono or nothing. Case needs to be re-designed to leave a flat "boss" around the opening for the headphone like other cases I've used with success.

title: Fits perfectly and switches work as they should. EDIT: Power switch doesn't work 02 Jan 2017
text:
Works flawlessly. Like original. Have been using for weeks now and it's been reliable, switches work, fits perfectly. Good deal all around.

*EDIT 02 Jan 2017. Just OK quality. Lasted about a year (not sure if the LG brand would have died as soon or not?). The power switch no longer works (but the vol up and down still does)

title: Perfect fit, protects well.
text: Like these TPU cases a lot. The work well at protecting your phone. This one fits like a glove, works great.

title: Love these. Genuine, high-amp and power anything that has a USB cable.
text: Love these chargers. They're genuine Samsung (but work with any equipment that uses std USB on one end) and high-amp (quick charging). Using for a while and so far, no problems. Even bought another one to take traveling.

title: Well designed and doesn't cause echo for callers
text: This is just like one I bought with my phone a few years ago in Taiwan. Awesome. Tough, doesn't cause echo for callers like all the other TPU cases I've bought since and is just the right density. Never broken a screen dropping a cell and using this case is why.

title: Too loose and rubbery, so it grabs on things and pulls itself off phone
text: A rubbery material, not like the TPU cases, and fit too loose, so it rubs itself off the phone when you put it in a pocket. Maybe not all are like that and I got one that happened to be too loose, but that's my experience, YMMV.

title: One of the best designs out there. And rugged!
text:
Love this phone STILL (well..., after a good rooting and custom ROM load anyway). It's still faster than most things comparable out there. Lots of RAM, I like the controls and darned if LG's aren't close to bullet-proof in reliability and toughness.

Only caveat is to make sure it's actually "new." The "new" one I received wasn't new and had issues. Had to have it repaired from faulty assy as soon as I received it (was probably a factory reject that was somehow sold). But the seller paid for pro repair and offered his own warranty on it. Fair enough. It's been great ever since.

title: The perfect protection! For your cell anyway...
text: This is just the right "toughness," not too squishy that it doesn't protect, stiff enough to stay on, but soft enough that the buttons work when you press through the TPU material. Very protective, fits like a glove, looks great, nothing bad to say.

title: One of the better offerings from LG
text:
Mom inherited this in short order (right away). She loves it. Those of you trying to get parents into smart-phones, tell them it's an extension of their computer. Or to think of it as their new, take-along computer. That might help.

Once they start running custom rom's and writing android code for tweaks, you can leave them on their own...

title: The hard plastic is pretty fragile. Now I use the TPU cases and ...
text: Broke the connecting nibs first time it dropped. The hard plastic is pretty fragile. Now I use the TPU cases and haven't looked back.

title: Good case, worth every penny, stiff to push buttons though
text: Love these TPU cases and how they protect. Would give this five stars, great color and not too "rubbery," but that's also its downfall. The switches are covered with thin material and it makes them really hard to press. I just pressed harder, but gave the phone and case to mom and it's really hard on her fingers to push through the TPU hard rubber to articulate the switches. Otherwise, great case. Great color and protective. Recommend razor-blading out the cutouts for the power and vol switches (the first one of these cases I bought in Taiwan last year and it had holes for the switches, so this would probably do fine with holes there too.

title: RUN AWAY!!!
text:
These came super quick. Impressed with that, but the quality of these are total CRAP! I've used screen protectors for years. Installed them on all of my own phones through the years and for most of my friends and relatives phones. Take your time, spotlessly clean the screen, work somewhere dust-free if possible, lay down the first side, bending the plastic as you go so you keep out any bubbles, rub out any small deformations, then remove the top plastic. You're done.

Except..., NOT with these. You can lay it out perfectly, no bubble, dust, perfect. THEN when you try to remove the top plastic (the blue label), it pulls the screen protector off with it and bubble galore. OK, trash that one. Start again. Same thing next time even holding the protector underneath. Still pulls up on it letting bubbles and dust in.

I normally buy the cheapo 5-per packs and they work fine. I'll stick with those from now on. This was a total waste of time and money. And totally frustrating!!

title: Looked cool, but scratched easy and broke fast.
text: If you never plan to take your cell out of its case to reset, pull SIM, pull battery, etc., then this might work for you, but the little tabs that hold it together break easy and  so does the case if you drop it. But the phone was fine, so it was a sacrificial situation. I'd rather have one that doesn't commit suicide in the process though. Now use the TPU cases on my phones. LOVE those.

title: All-around great phone - wish custom ROMs were still being programmed for it...
text: Been running 4.1.1 on this for a while. Custom ROM (JB, but older). Solid, love the functionality. Could be speedier, but it's now an "older" phone, so what to expect? Overall does all that I need and does it well with some custom apps. Even today, for the price, this phone is worth every penny.

title: These are not new and genuine, one or the other, but not both
text: I ordered one, it came, was scratched and used (albeit less than the one I was replacing), they claimed it was a new one they were selling, but weren't surprised when I said it looked used. This was SO not new. Then ordered another one from another vendor and that was aftermarket and poor quality. That company sent a "genuine" replacement to that one, and it was obviously scratched and used. Just gave up. Still have a scratched cover, the rest of phone is great though.

title: Work perfectly. One of the few things lately that do that (economically)
text: This is long, not so thick that it is too heavy and falls out, fits both USB and the Micro-USB nice and tight and works perfectly, for both data and charging. Would buy again if I needed another one. Have been using daily for a few weeks now, not probs, we'll see how it holds up, but it appears well-made enough to go the distance.

title: Works great, just as it's supposed to, but...
text: First of all, this works like a charm. No problems. Charges a phone batt, just like it says. But..., like the other reviewers say, the charge light is REALLY bright. Red when charging, blue when charged, either one, like landing lights on a runway. Neighbors call and ask me if the house is on fire in the middle of the night while the battery is charging. Next night when it was charged and blue, they called the NSA convinced that aliens were inside, scanning my brain. Passers by would slow and take pictures of the house with the eerie blue glow in the windows. If you search my address on google earth at night, you'll see either a red or blue haze surrounding the block I live on, depending on if my phone batt is charging or charged. When I call for an ambulance, I just have to tell them, "look for the house with the red or blue glowing windows." Response: "Oh..., that's YOUR house? We thought aliens lived there?"

title: Virgin Mobile phone, but unlocked for anyone
text:
Phone came with Virgin Mobile SW installed, but it truly was new and unlocked for any carrier. I am with T-Mobile and it works fine and totally unlocked with this service provider. Also works with an AT&T sim card. So far, so good. Only complaint with the phone, and I think it's with all the Optimus One phones, is that the touch sensitivity can't be adjusted. I dropped a transmission/xfer case from a truck on my hand while working alone in a garage (never trust an imported transmission jack!) and with blood and grease all over both hands by the time I got my phone out, tapping, hitting swiping, etc. on the screen keyboard to unlock it yielded nothing. I had to go dig-out my old RAZR, put this sim in it, restart to be able to call someone for help. Don't trust this to work in an emergency or with wet fingers or shaky hands. The touch sensitivity isn't high enough and for some, it's too high.

All in all a fantastic phone for the value and it was shipped really fast and worked perfect when it arrived (as should be expected of a new phone).

title: Not water resistant
text: These are not water resistant when washing hands or showering. Instead they trap water between the case and the watch. It protects the screen from scratches so far. It's annoying to take off the case and dry it throughly each time water gets in contact with it. I like that I can switch up the colors.

title: Useless product
text: After putting this screen on it cracked less than a week later. My iPhone screen survived much bigger drops than this screen protector did. Fell once and that was the end. Such a waste. Save your money.

title: Does not charge airpods as listed
text: I used this device to charge my iphone. It does the job. It does not charge my airpods that I recently purchased. I Will have to buy another device that does.

title: Useless after a week.
text: Ive only been using my screen protector for a week and it already has a v-shape crack across. I've never dropped my new phone. I can't imagine if it had fallen. I doubt the others in the set will hold up.

title: Great bands for the price
text: These are a great set of bands for my fitbit charge 2.  I wear my fitbit daily and the bands tend to break where it connects to the device over time.  I like that these come in multiple colors for a great price.  They seem durable so far. I hope these will last.

title: Good protection
text: I love clear, thick, rubber cases for my phones. This one is great and feels protective and durable. Extra thick around the corners and edges. After a year it has definitely started to yellow but that has been my experience with every clear case.

title: DO NOT BUY, this product damaged my iPhone
text: I'm beyond upset with these screen protectors. I bought these for my 6s and after only one week of use the bottom corner of the screen protector cracked. Another week later a piece of the screen protector from the top middle area chipped off and ended up being wedged between the actual phone and the protective case causing a deep scratch on my brand new iPhone. I bought these to protect my phone and instead it damaged it. I am horribly angry and recommend you DO NOT BUY this product unless you want your phone ruined. Wish I could do negative stars..

title: Too small
text: Do not purchase. This case doesn't fit the Samsung Galaxy A21.
